great hotel having read reviews about moderately priced hotels in la i was worried about reports of unsafe neighbourhoods unfriendly staff and dirty rooms  one reported dried blood on the bedhead  i chose the crowne plaza beverly hills because of generally positive tripadvisor reviews its location and access to good public transport and i was not disappointed i can thoroughly recommend this hotel the staff were friendly the rooms very clean and the beds were so comfortable i had trouble getting my daughter up in the mornings we joined the hotel chain s priority club and received a complimentary breakfast each morning which was more than adequate and saved us dollars the bathrooms were a little small and needed updating but they were fine there was easy access to the city bus system with the big blue busstop to santa monica beach just around the corner and the metro to downtown outside the front door we were in walking distance to rodeo drive we had no trouble getting around using the public transport system and enjoyed our stay in la and at the crowne plaza

totally disappointed i ve booked a room because of its name  crowne plaza but what i found was a terrible hotel the room was dirty and smelly i asked in the front desk for another room but they did not have one at that moment on my 3rd day the bathtub starts to flood i asked again for another room and what i got was another dirty and smelly room stained towels smelly pillows used bandaid in the floor   on the check out i have filled the guest survey but never had an answer for my complains   so   i would not stay here if someone paid me to

friendly hotel i stayed at the beverly hills crowne plaza during october 2005 for 2 nights as a priority club member  membership is free   guestrooms are on the top two floors and breakfast is provided free of charge on the lobby level if you re a fan of big hotel buffet breakfasts then the priority club breakfast is not for you it consists of cereals a fruit platter toast a few types of pastries  croissants apricot danish cherry danish  fruit juice and coffee i stayed on the 11th floor and the views of beverly hills were very nice and expansive rooms on the left side of the hotel will give you views of downtown the hotel pictures do not do the rooms justice they are plush rooms with the most comfortable beds and very warm furnishings plus the welcome pack is very nice the location in beverly hills is excellent an easy five minute walk to major restaurants and clothing shops with rodeo drive around the corner being los angeles nothing is going to be close without a car anyway so being in a nice safe neighbourhood with eateries in close walking distance is very comforting there are buses on the main strip just left of the hotel going to santa monica and downtown

very comfortable stayed here for 2 nights from 22nd oct to 24th oct staff where very friendly and helpful restuarant although not a great selection of choice overall food was of high standard location is very good within walking distance of restautants overall very comfortable and pleasant stay and would most definately come back here again

satisfactory place to stay beautiful lobby scary garage that is detached from the hotel rooms are average size with nice beds only high speed internet access with no other options or bridges locations is shady but near other hotels rate is cheap

fun good location nice we recently stayed here for 3 days in may 05 and it was great the pool area is not currently under construction the lobby is huge and dark and a great place to hang out and have drinks the rooms are small but very clean and modern it was good to be right in the middle of everything sure the area is filled with tourists but it s a fairly central place to take a cab to anything else if you need to the walls are very thin but that didn t bother us  unfortunately we were not haunted by montgomery clift as is rumored to happen  the only bad thing was the minibar fridge is so small you can t keep any of your own stuff in there and you have to pay for wireless connectivity

cavernous and oldworld this is an ok hotel but it never felt particularly comfortable to me it has a bit of a gloomy cavernous atmosphere  an old but renovated hotel that has a wellfurnished but dim lobby long hallways and a lot of meeting and retail space that seems to be unused the staff seemed pretty erratic and the place lacks adequate signage getting my luggage brought up by the bell staff was unnecessarily difficult and i ended up getting the bags for myself there is a very nice outdoor pool surrounded by a courtyard adjacent to the hotel i also spent a while looking for a phantom fitness room that turned out to be closed but none of the hotel s materials included that key fact overall this is not a place with a tremendous amount of warmth even though it has a good location in the heart of hollywood

not as great as promised stayed overnite in a junior suite on the 9th floor i ve stayed numerous times at the rennaissance down the way and wanted to give this place a try the hotel location is great the room was spacious and the decor was chic lots of extras very clean however the room is not well insulated and you can hear your neighbors quite well along with the hollywood boulevard traffic that runs all night  people yelling and taxi cabs honking away  the airconditioning heating furnace appliances are extremely loud and go off and on even when the units are turned off we had unplugged the refrigerator thinking that was the noise in the junior suite the bathroom is enlongated with a shower stall at the very end a tub in front of that and then the toilet next to the door the layout was odd and getting into and out of the shower was awkward poor lighting in the bathroom not a restful stay rennaissance way better

very disappointing we stayed here for four days from thanksgiving we selected it based on the reviews on this site but were very disappointed the price is ok but the rooms were not what we thought we were getting we had booked a suite as we were travelling with our two teenage sons the suite is actually only one bedroom with the second bed in the lounge kitchen area we asked for a rollaway bed  as the boys are unwilling to share a bed and were assured that it wouldn t be too cramped we found that it was very cramped the kitchen was very small and did not have a dishwasher and there were no tea towels to dry things the oven seals kept falling off the moment the oven was heated and the oven door did not fully close there were no dishes in which you could put leftover food we were given one room but the moment we walked in we could smell urine so asked to be moved to another room which the staff did the carpet on the floor was dirty  as mentioned in another review  staff did not come in to clean the rooms until around 5pm which meant that we had already arrived back from being out all day and were getting ready for the night s activities getting luggage to the room was difficult one alternative is to carry them up to the third floor or use the lift the lift is only accessible from the road via the garage the garage is locked and had to be opened for us and the lift is extremely small so only 1 large suitcase  we had 4 in total and carry ons as we had been travelling round the world for the previous 6 weeks would fit in meaning a number of trips had to be taken to bring all of the luggage up the staff were courteous and the location is good

great value great location this place is a bit worn around the edges but has great amenities and the value cannot be beat we paid 119 for a one bedroom suite with a kitchen   the oven didn t work but everything else did free parking walk 30 seconds to the hollywood highlands center and about 5 minutes walk to several family friendly options on hollywood blvd which is less scary than it s been in years if you decide to leave the car in the garage you can take the metro to downtown and other locations my only small complaint was that the pool wasn t heated but it was november   so maybe it s only heated seasonally that didn t keep my daugther from swimming it s not the ritz but a very family friendly affordable accomodation
great location great location for hollywood boulevard and shopping universal studios a short drive away large clean rooms helpful reception perfect location for exploring hollywood free car park

fantastic location and good secure hotel we have just completed a 4 night stay here and were quite impressed with the hotel as most of the reviews state the location is perfect right behind kodak theatre mann chinese theatre  hollywood  highland mall whilst the hotel is not brand new of course if you do your research you already know that before you book the price is reasonable and it is in this brilliant location we had arrived into la early that morning and after picking up our rental car and doing some sightseeing we arrived at the hotel a couple of hours before check in they allowed us to park in the carpark and we had a look through the mall until our room was ready our room was very large with 2 armchairs a separate hallway lead to a large wardrobe and down to the bathroom and there was a separate kitchen with dining table so we were able to have breakfast in the morning before going out the room was also very clean and there was a courtyard off the main area if you wanted to sit outside or you can also sit at tables near the pool area there is also free wifi internet as well my partner and i would certainly recommend this hotel and should we return to la in the future we would definitely stay here

location location location stayed for 4 nights late in july with partner and 2 kids  18y o and 15 y o  booked after reading reviews here on ta and everything was just as expected if you want 5 luxury then look elswhere if you want decent accomodation in the heart of la at a reasonable price then look no further sure the place is a little dated and the rooms could all do with some attention but at the end of the day it s a hotel and is to be used as a base and somewhere to sleep we booked a one bed suite so the kids could have a seperate sleeping area and we found the room to be large enough to accomodate us all easily there was a kitchen area but we never used if for more than boiling a kettle this place is all about location  within 2 minutes you can be right on hollywood boulevard in the middle of the action there are lots of places to eat in and around the hollywood and highlands centre and even a great view of the hollywood sign access is easy and the underground parking and free  although intermmitent wifi came in handy for keeping in touch front desk more than helpful when required and we did hear the traffic making deliveries to the hh centre but it never disturbed us kids loved the pool after a hot steamy day in la overall we were very glad we booked this hotel and would have no hesitation in recommending to others who are looking for reasonably priced accomodation in the heart of los angeles
great stay       kitchen

not for me stayed at this hotel for one night in july one night was plenty we got there early and was told that we couldn t check in because the room wasn t ready we could park there though which was good for us the parking is under the hotel and is accessed only by a locked gate the whole place has locks everywhere locks to the garage locks to the front desk locks to the stairwells i wonder how bad it is that they have to lock everything we walked over to hollywood and highland which looks like a new outdoor mall very nice place within minutes of the hotel we then walked hollywood blvd went back to the hotel and was told we could check in went to our room only to find cleaning ladies still there they rushed out of there they only left two towels for four people i had to go find them to get more towels room was just okay it was really big but very outdated it had a weird smell the bed was extremely uncomfortable very lumpy terrible room was as clean as it could be for a very old place the pool was very clean although we didn t use it the worst part about the whole thing is at 530 am you feel like you re at a freight terminal you re right behind the mall so you hear trucks backing up making deliveries unloading of the trucks and trucks ideling while waiting to unload the whole hotel was up by then or so it seemed this place is alright for one night but imo i wouldn t stay here again

excellent location first of all good large rooms with kingsizebeds great value free wireless internet free parking and best of all location located by kodak theatre and with walkoffame just seconds away this was a great place to stay in la from here you can see the famous hollywoodsign walk down walkoffame and universal studios is just 10 minutes by car away

an average hotel but what a great location we stayed at the hollywood orchid suites for three days we could park our rental car in the underground parking of the hotel which was very convenient the building looks quite dated as does the lobby but the lady at the front desk was very friendly the room was large and it had a separate fully equiped kitchen with a dining table the funiture and drapes were clean but not very modern in the kitchen there was an unpleasant smell of which we have not been able to determine the cause the reason we chose this hotel was the location in the center of hollywood right behind the kodak theather it proved to be a good choice there are plenty of eateries nearby and after catching a movie at the man chinese theater it is only a five minute stroll to your bed if you re not looking for a very modern hotel but want your hotel to be in a top location chose the hollywood orchid suites

hollywood orchid fit the bill this motel is an old apartment complex made over into a suites hotel key word is old although the property could stand with some major updating i would stay there again in a new york minute the location was absolutely outstanding the staff was very friendly and helpful free parking very large suite  we were in a deluxe king  secure free safe in room and relatively clean  not spotless but clean enough  the pool area was very very clean and looked quite inviting but we were on the go from 9am until at least 10pm every day there so we did not get a chance to swim i would recommend this motel to anyone on a budget but looking for great value and location i would not recommend this motel to someone who is accustomed to 4 or 5 star type hotel resorts

an apartment in a convenient location we had an executive 2bed suite which had a combined living and sleeping room one separate kitchen and a terrace the apartment is probably 60m2 in total there isn t much walking space in the combined living and sleeping room where there are 2 beds a tv and 2 armchairs the dining table  for 4 people are in the kitchen the kitchen is equipped with the usual kitchen stuff though the only things we used were the coffee machine and kettle there is an aircon as well as a heater in the combined sleeping and living room one point to highlight is that the carpet is rather sticky we walked barefoot in the room and after a while our soles were all black i also killed an unidentified bug in the room but i won t say it s exactly the hotel s fault because when i was walking along the streets outside at night i saw a lot of cockroaches so maybe it s just the general condition of that part of la there is also free internet and printer and paper in the lobby the apartment is located in an area accessible by lots of bus lines and the metro red line we took the metro to chinatown and the buses to sunset strip farmer s market and the grove and the la brea tar pits we were in la again at the last part of our trip and we stayed at another hotel in another part of la while it had been a hassle problemfree stay at orchid suites i probably would try another place or stay with the other hotel that i have stayed at in this trip if i were to revisit la

orchid suites hollywood i ve stayed in some excellent locations but it is hard to beat this one barely 30 seconds walk to the hollywood  highland centre 3 minute walk to red line metro 90 seconds to starbucks etc the rooms are an excellent size with kitchen living area bedroom and bathroom staff varied in terms of helpfulness and friendliness no one was rude but one particular lady did annoy me who continued to chat on the phone whilst serving me my biggest complaint was to do with general upkeep some small repairs did need to be undertaken in our room  104  hole in bed blanket very top bit missing off cold tap tap drips hairdryer didn t work we did mention this to reception but nothing got done to correct problem toilet became blocked easily i was given a plunger wireless internet worked fine in living room but the signal was too weak to use in bedroom overall i might stay here again if you want a bed for the night in a great location stay here if you want anything more look for somewhere else note to get to the hotel from the hollywood highlands metro station the easiest route is to turn right out of the station pass a couple of shops you ll then be at the entrance to hollywood  highlands centre go up escalator to level 2 then head left across courtyard pass kodak shop on your right and take exit tunnel next to kodak shop on walking out on to the street you ll see the hotel diagonally left of you

location locstion location we stayed 4 nights at this great hotel okay the kitchens were a little dated but clean the size of the rooms were massive we had a two bed suite  i think thats what it was  in the first room there was a superking size bed  an armchair  tv  dinning table and 4 chairs and a complete kitchen all but a washing machineand masses of room then through a short hallway which had 2 sliding mirrored doors which housed the safe and hanging space and shelves also another cupboard with hanging space into a mirrored area with sink and mirrored cabinet on the wall off of this was a toilet and bath with shower over and also another room with a superking bed and mirrored built in wardrobes  2 bedside cabinets and tv this room also had a ceiling fan as well as air con between the first room at the start of the hallway was a hidden sliding door that you could close if privacy was needed  bit detailed i know but when i want info on a place i like to know it all was a very secure hotel with doors locked at night and couldnt get in without your key or the desk clerk letting you in the free wifi in room would have been good if we had bought our laptops but there is a free pc on second floor with a free printer great location 20 yards or so from the mall when you walk through the mall and come out in the open go left and there a great view of the hollywood sign you must try the restaraunt called the grill upstairs in the mall the steaks are to die for also a johnny rockets and other ast food places

my only complaint my only complaint is that we stayed there the carpet was so dirty that my feet were black the bed was terrible they were late getting the room ready and while we were walking in they said  in broken english don t touch the walls the paint is still wet the people upstairs was stomping all night even after i called the front desk to complain the bathroom window was open and unable to close   so no showers glad we only stayed 2 nights   but 2 nights toooooo long i will say that the size of the room was nice and the location was great but that is about all i can say nice
great place to stay

loved this hotel i came to hollywood with my mom in law for a film festival off of beverly we had previously booked a room at the farmer s daughter but cancelled once we found this sweet bargain a very much affordable suite hotel within walking distance of hollywood blvd and shopping attractions plus great security and free onsite parking how can that be beatthe room was terrific plenty of space with a full kitchen and dining area we had a balcony too we had booked one of the 2bedroom executive suites it was very clean with comfortable beds for once i did not wake up with a backache from sleeping in a strange bed the staff was very friendly and informative i also got great use of the free high speed internet computer available i was able to print out much needed directions with ease i will most definitely stay at the orchid again great value and great price  donna

great location lovely place having just got off the plane in la we were quite jetlagged and tired but this place was relatively easy to find and there was ample underground parking for our hire car the front desk was courteous and we were very quickly checked in and went to our mini apartment on the first floor although it wasn t a beautiful building the decoration was fine and it was clean and felt safe there was a small pool although it was overshadowed by the many buildings around it and when we went in winter it looked pretty cold the location was amazing  round the corner from the center of hollywood with easy access to the underground trains and the main highways of los angeles only negative points about the location were that it was right next to the back entrance of a large mall  great for easy access but meant we were occasionally disturbed by distribution trucks we booked a selfcatering apartment that came with most basic kitchen items although filters for the coffee maker would have been much appreciated

what a dump we just returned from la to visit our granddaughter i found the orchid online and it seemed ok being on a dead end street enticed us thinking it would be quiet and the price seemed reasonable         well as the proverb says you get what you pay for while having complimentary underground parking i can think of nothing else good the rooms are old and seem to be a converted condo studio apartment deal spacious yes niceno the bed is the worst we have ever slept on and the noise my god we were there on a saturday night and the construction noise sounded as if they were in the basement each time a door slammed or a phone rang or an ambulance raced by you were awakened plan carefully when coming to la and avoid staying at this cute hotel

great stay were a bit dubious about the outside but as soon as we got inside the staff were wonderful we have two little boys and they made an effort to remember their names and gave them a little gift each the room was huge with own kitchen with every possible thing in it unlike most hotel kitchens even the housekeeping staff were great very clean a few stains on floor but staff cant do anything about that little laundy  vending machine downstairs it is definately not 5 star but they were so nice comfortable and so close to everything not the best area some bums and weirdos butthe big shopping plaza next door was very upmarket with lots of shops and great views of hollywood sign oh and free internet and printing
unbeatable location

thin walls i doubt there could be a lower priced hotel room located in as good a location in los angeles our room was spacious and was pretty much like a studio apartment washers and dryers are located in the basement next to the underground parking just across the road is the super luxurious renaissance hotel with room rates 3 times that of the hollywood orchid suites if money is not an issue stay at the renaissance for those with a limited budget like us the hollywood orchid suites is a really good option we did have problems with the noise though we were woken up at 4am by loud laughter and excited girls voices outside our room the next night we were woken up by heavy footsteps and other banging noises from the room above ours the walls are so thin that we can hear the people staying in the room next to ours talking to each other but we were out most of the day it s a short walk to the metro from where it s one stop away from universal studios in one direction and one stop away from the pantages theatre  where we watched an excellent performance of wicked in the other direction

great location my daughter grandson and i stayed 2 nights august 1516 2007 at the orchid suites hotel the hotel is walking distance to hollywood and highland mall and all the other hollywood sites our room had 2 queen beds full kitchen and a balcony our first night we went to the mall for the whole evening and returned to our room around 900pm the next day we went to universal studios and it was late when we returned so parking was an issue in the uderground parking lot but someone was leaving as we came back so we were able to park some parking spaces are very tight there is also parking on the street our last morning we went back to mall before checkout we would recommend this hotel to everyone we felt safe walking to the mall there is a post office right before the entrance to the mall there s a lot of restaurants in the mall fun fun fun  <class>positive

location location you cannot get much closer to hollywood blvd the walk of fame chinese theatre than this   this is literally a two minutes walk to the walk of fame the service was fantastic very helpful people even helped find where the resturant we were going to was printed off maps give us some good helpful tips for la the rooms were big roomy and clean bit on the old side but for dollar value and location this place is well worth it also free internet on the second floor which is always handy highly reccommended

good location we stayed at this hotel in december 2006 pros excellent location very close to all the action good price  secure parking pool looked nice  although we did not use it cons room was kind of dark  no view and felt very dated carpets need cleaning and room had a slight smell to it overall the hotel was okay for the price it was basic but nice

best one star rated hotel in my book a one star rating someone needs to look at that this place for a family etc is the best spacious rooms and the location is perfect went with my family a 6 in one suite plenty of room hubby and i even had a seperate bedroom clean kitchen for cooking pool  you really couldn t ask for more their staff was more then accomadating my suburban fit in their 6 4 garage which we thought it wouldnt so parking big plus theres a huge mall right out the front door i can t say enough and i was so nervous because we didn t know area and the one star rating go for it   just skip the tours of famous peoples houses rip off  all you see is bushes  and the bushes are 15feet high save your  thanks orchid we ll be back for sure

convenient clean and very comfortable we are a family of five who just returned from a short two night stay at orchid suites at the end of a two week multicity vacation the location was very convenient kodak theater and highlands mall next door with well lit access  universal studios and warner brothers studios were part of our sightseeing and both were very easy to reach and only a short drive from the property staff was very welcoming and attentive to all needs questions and assisted with tour arrangements driving directions two king suite was very large and spacious more than adequate room for bags rollaway bed and 3 teenage children kitchen was convenient for drinks snacks rooms appear older but are well maintained clean and comfortable with most ammenities of a newer 4 star hotel at an affordable rate pool made for a relaxing break from or after sightseeing parking very safe secure we would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay there again if our travels take us back to hollywood area

exceeded expectations we expected somewhere cheapish and cheerful   which we got but also a lot more we didn t expect the location to be so fantastic  steps from a huge mall steps from hollywood boulevard and a couple of minutes walk from the metro also right next door is a cinema complex a theatre and  just out of interest the place where they give out the academy awards we didn t expect free parking which was a real bonus nor did we expect the rooms to be quite so clean and spacious the front desk was very friendly and helpful too all in all we would highly recommend this location for a comfortable and surprisingly quiet stay in the heart of hollywood

great location secure parking  70s feel we stayed here for three nights in july we booked it as we were doing a road trip and needed safe secure central parking we booked the two king room suite and were delighted the suite was very large with lots of hanging space the bathroom was clean and more than adequate as was the kitchenette we even had a table and chairs to seat 4 a breakfast bar and still loads of space for cases etc the teak furniture  drapes  coverlets etc were a bit tired and gave the place a distinctly 70 s feel and it smelt a bit musty initially but it was clean and we felt this added to the character of the place overall the pool although small was great fun and a very welcome bonus after a day on your feet trying to get a cab or chancing your arm in a car   the service was friendly and the rooms were cleaned daily  considering its excellent central position and the secure parking which can be extremely costly we considered this place excellent value for moneyand very much enjoyed our stay my only gripe would be that the windows were not particularly secure so we took our valuables with us when we went out

basic but location makes up for it we stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of our trip and then 2 nights at the end before flying home the location is fantastic and right in the heart of hollywood rooms are very basic and smell rather musty and old however they are well equipped we had the two king suite and used the spare bed to lay all the suitcases on which was useful the kitchen was huge there are some restaurants nearby in the hollywood and highland but the steak grill place turned out to be a disaster some people mentioned the wolfgang puck place was better there is a small store nearby selling breakfast items although the rate we paid was good  129 and tax per night i do feel that it is highly priced for what you get due to the facilities being so old although if two couples were sharing the two king suites it would be a bargain the location makes up for this we did not have any problems during our stay although they do clean the rooms late in the day  3pm

nice location bit outdated but clean and spacious room stayed here for two nights in april 2007 based on tripadvisor reviews this hotel shows it s age but is however still a good place to stay the room was clean and very spacious we had a suite with a full kitchen seating area dining table and seperate bedroom parking is complimentary in the  closed parking garage below the location is perfect for visiting downtown hollywood it s a 2 minute walk to the hollywood  highland mall next to grauman s chinese theatre

terrific value i stayed at the orchid suites for a week in may 07 with a couple of friends we booked a 2king suite plus a rollaway for about 139 night plus tax this configuration was great for us but it was sort of like 2 bedrooms with a kitchen in betweenif you want a more traditional living room setup there s a layout that replaces the 2nd king with a queensized sleeper sofa other configurations are available as well the kitchen was a real plusin addition to a fullsized refrigerator freezer stove microwave and toaster oven it included dishware silverware  including a corkscrew  a coffee maker wih a daily coffee cream sugar setup salt and pepper and paper towels we saved a lot of money by being able to buy groceries and take home leftovers and saved even more with the free parking the location was greatyou can cut through the back entrance to the highland center and be on hollywood blvd  and at a metro stop in under 5 minutes a 24 hour drugstore  long s and a food market are about 2 blocks down the blvd the hollywood freeway  101 is a straight shot by car just a couple of minutes away there are also onsite laundry facilities and pretty extensive vending machines on the ground floor the negatives are pretty much what other reviewers mentioned tired decor  but clean  a shower meant for short people some outside noise from delivery trucks and passersby on the outer walkways and some ceiling noise from people on the floor above you  did not detect noise on either side though  all in all a terrific valuei d recommend it for families or other travellers who are looking for a convenient costeffective base for sightseeing as opposed to a desination resort

great location but a rather tired hotel the hotel was easy to find  using yahoo maps and has a brilliant location for accessing universal studios  simple 10 min drive  the staff owners were very friendly helpful and for what you pay it is difficult to find fault with hotel to be honest however the rooms are very tired and in desperate need of refurbishment they are large though and have all the facilities that you need for a short stay it also has a great little swimming pool if you want a great location and a cheap and cheerful experience you won t be disappointed with this hotel

cheap and cenrtal stay here with my wife and two teenage kids  17 and 19  i got what i expected not top star accomadation and a price match but clean central and well priced noise the suites are on the north side of the kodak theatre close to the walk etc but can be troubled by the bin lorry at 6 am or deliveries to the large hotel next to the theatre the room also had a noisy fridge and the walkways infront of the rooms is wooden just right for an early morning case being pulled along noise aside great helpful staff on front desk free secure parking and free internet overall a good place to stay if you want something above basic stayed for 4 nights went to universal six flags and the getty centre  recommended  if you want a good classy evening meal go to the grill on 3rd floor of the theatre

okay great location we stayed here for 2 nights april 1112th 2007 with 3 kids 15 and under the location is right behind the kodak theatre so it is in the heart of hollywood near hollywood and highland my oldest didn t feel safe walking around hollywood itself i think he could sense the seedy side of it street performers jimmy kimmel live is right there tons of shops etc ran out of time would have loved to drive to beverly hills santa monica etc we did go to the farmer s market in hopes of star spotting but didn t see anyone famous they had the largest yummiest strawberries there i ve ever seen or tasted yum  other than a few fresh fruit and vegetable stand areas it is just an outdoor mall of regular stores where apparently some stars like to shop the hotel is clean  convenient but very old some paint was peeling off the walls the bedroom window wouldn t lock etc bed was comfortable we had a 2 king suite with a full kitchen and a safe in the closet which was nice underground parking garage for free and a washer dryer area down in the garage area 1 outdoor heated pool nothing fancy here free internet access on a computer in the common area on our floor which was nice with a 15 minute per person limit tiny elevator just a very basic hotel

orchid suites return to heaven in 2007 last year in september 2006 i wrote a review of hollywood orchid suites where i said that my fiance and i loved the place well it now april 2007 my fiance is now my lovely wife and we are both here again at orchid suites celebrating our honeymoon i could say we knew what to expect when checking in for our third stay here at this wonderful partment hotelbut you can always be surprised not only does the hotel live up to all our expectations we were delighted when the staff gave us a bottle of champagne as a honeymoon gift and we were even more surprised to find the apartment we had stayed in and were to stay in again had received new lounges and what i believe is new carpet fantastic   this place it awesome it is above and beyond a hotel room the staff go above and beyond what you hope for when staying anywhere in the us overall orchid suites is just a wonderful safe and convenient place to stay while checking out the sights julie and i are planning another trip for january 2008 and we can say without question we will be staying with grace and the team at orchid suites the only place more comfortable is our own apartment in australia

okay but noisy  we are a family of four who stayed at this hotel for 3 nights the positives to this hotel are  location  short walk to the boulevard and right behind major shopping centre    this is also a weakness refer below  free internet large rooms good security  front door access via key or reception clearance  warm pool self contained kitchen  good price for the areaweaknesses to this hotel are  noisy due to location as this is the last hotel at the end of a short street located at the rear of a shopping centre there is a large volume of delivery and truck traffic from early morning if you are a light sleeper you will hear it all  if you have heavy guests on the floor above the noise from the thin floors is accentuated we were kept awake by this for a whole night by people upstairs from us  decor is oldon balance the location of this property and the security were what we required in view of having two kids under 10 would recommend to others but be aware of the possible noise issues particularly with delivery trucks from approx 4 am onwards

not an orchild but a daisy 109 night for two nights basically an apartment suite with 1980 s decor my room smell like smoke saw cigerette burns in the carpet maybe it was a smoking room in the past had two tv s full kitchen  who s got time to cook  very spacious bathroom was clean free internet access and a pool  i never saw anyone use  the checkin guy smoked in the office which i could smell it while on i was using the internet great location felt pretty safe you could cut thru the back of the kodiak theatre to go to hollywood blvd best part free secured parking and very close to subway  3 all day ride  its not fabulous but good enough to stay there again great chinese food place around the corner mel s diner is down the street too

never again the only thing pleasant about this stay was the location the room was a decent size but everything in there was soooo old looking that it was scary the cups and dishes looked like they were rinsed off and put back into the cabinet our microwave looked like it hadn t been cleaned since 1902 eck on top of that the front desk kept calling our room with complaints from people who live in the hotel stating that we were talking too loud    we had to whisper in our room on our vacation unheard of     the front desk called us at exactly 1201 to let us know that it was time for us to check out  duhhhhhhh we were on our way out the door i have been to plenty of hotels and have never had anyone call my room a minute after check out and tell me that it was time to get out rude rude rude sorry but i would rather fork out more money for a nice hotel next time this place was disgusting

this is the one my family of two adults and four kids have stayed in the liberty hotel  hollywood celebrity hotel orchid suites  the old holiday inn  now the renaissanse hotel  on previous holidays in la and we found the orchid suites best by far big clean rooms and positioned right behind graumans hollywood and highland the metro and all the action in the best part of hollywood blvd parking is free and the staff are happy  helpful we had a king suite with 2 king beds and a fold away bed and it was huge it had a seperate bedroom a useable kitchenthat came in very handy we saved a lot by cooking our own breakfast  dinner and a big living area and 2 tv s the suites are a little tired and worn but pluses far and away beat the minuses the hotel is well maintained and clean and has a pool as i mentioned before we stayed at the liberty hotel on a previous trip  found the rooms small cell like  noisey  loud people wandering the hallways at night  and the celebrity hotelalthough our rooms were big ours was smelly and dark my wife swears she woke up and saw a ghost standing in the corner of our room so we were out like a shot the next morning if you want a huge room suite in a perfect part of hollywood and dont want to pay 4 star prices you have found it here i love the place  we are back here mid march 2007    cant wait

excellent find my husband and i stayed here for 3 nights in april and it was fantastic the location is unbeatable  we were worried it might have been over exaggerated on the website  the room we had was massive with a great bathroom and the pool was lovely the laundry facilities also came in useful i d recommend this to everyone and can t wait to stay here again

wow what a great find  the suite was clean large and everything worked because the hotel is a converted apartment building it had a lot of great things that you don t get in regular hotels such four options of switches in the bathroom fairly sound proof rooms and windows that actually open the bathtubs were equipped with those handy bars for those of us getting older than we d like the beds were very comfortable  with new matresses   the staff was really helpful the maintenance man even gave my family a tour of the suite and made doubly sure everything worked when we checked in the best thing was that the price was what was quoted i e no add ons such as parking fees spa fees internet access entertainment package fees   only the required bed tax  now 14  it was very quiet and unbelieveably close to all the main hollywood attractions my kids begged me to stay here everytime we come to los angeles i am only too happy to grant their request what a great value for my money

cheap   you get what you pay for we decided to stay at the hollywood orchid suites due to the wonderful reviews we read here on trip advisor it was as the reviewer below me explained a converted apartment building the beds as stated were awful one of them even had ripped up sheets on the bed the tubs   same as the other person said   dirty and the skid strips looked nasty  i am wondering if we had the same room or if they are all like this there is a kitchen dont look around too much  you might see the roach motel that is in the bottom cupboard i hated it here i hated hollywood period but this hotel sure didnt help they said that there is a roof top garden  there is   but nothing to write home about i think the cleanest thing here was all the clothes in my bags that never went into any of those drawers this place is convenient cheap and very accesible to all the hollywood things but if you can pick somewhere clean and with more comfortable beds and sans the roach motel   i would do that instead

what a dump yes it is cheap yes it is in a good location but i wish i had paid more at a clean hotel and not felt like i had to wear shoes in the room because i did not want to step on the carpet with my bare feet the widow in the bathroom was caked in dirt and what appeared to be mold the bed was like laying on concrete absolutely horible sleeping conditions i put a towel down in the tub when i took a shower because i didn t want to step on the non skid strips in the tub because they had filth on the side of them yuk fortunately i was only there two nights and could not wait to get out of there my advise    save up your money to stay at a real hotel not some converted apartment building it was a miserable stay

the orchid can t be beat i have to concur with all the other reviews on here this is the best hotel to stay in in hollywood bar none the price is great the rooms are clean and amazingly big and the location is better than anything hollywood has to offer one block to hollywood boulevard and all the attractions there  a locked underground parking lot with passkey and you can access the garage without leaving the hotel my wife and i are going on vacation in two weeks and this will be our second stay here and after trying several different hotels we plan on using the orchid exclusively from now on

great value  great location the location is brilliant litererally 2 minute walk from the walk of fame very reasonable rate i think only paid 80 dollars a night  it was clean and comfortable and so spacious  the bed was the biggest bed i have ever slept in it wasnt really warm enough to use the pool but it looked nice the lift was a bit small but still ok

fantastic value this place was fantastic   great value for money and so close to hollywood boulevard  the staff were great    it is a little older but clean and spacious and it was fantastic to have a kitchen  l would recommend this to anyone and personally are glad to have stayed there   aaaaaa

okay great location after a bad experience with best western we chose this hotel because our tourist guide recommended it the hotel is located in downtown hollywood right behind the kodak theatre they have their own parking garage which you can open with your room key they have a laundry service too and an elevator we had a junior suite  smallest room on the third floor the room was very spacious because it used to be an appartment building we had a kitchenette too wireless internet didnt work properly we had to sit on the floor right next to the door to have access  but that didnt work all the time  staff was okay but not very friendly the worst thing was the connecting door our neighbours had some kind of party the whole night they had loud music first and then talked so loud and screamed and did some other things i wont mention here best thing about the hotel is the location walking distance to hollywood boulevard is about 2 minutes there is a shopping centre nearby which has restaurants too and live music

amazing value excellent location we stayed in a deluxe suite from 11th to 14th april 2006 it s an amazing find the rates are great the location is unbelievable it s located in a cul de sac behind highland and hollywood shopping centre  there s a back door so it only takes a minute to get there with a good range of shops and restaurants and also contains the kodak theatre where the oscars are held and the subway is very near by  which was very easy to use and one stop to universal studios  it s on the same block as the chinese theatre with the walk of fame running along it it s also quite close the freeway which made it easy to find and despite the traffic straight forward to get to disney to in just over an hour the area felt very safe and the accomodation had a good level of security there was free underground locked parking and always free spaces the staff were extreamley helpful and let us keep are car there after check out the property is very well maintained and very clean our apartment was very spacious and clean the furniture is very comfortable and well maintained although it might be a bit dated for some peoples tastes  we had a large open plan lounge with sofa bed armchairs dinning table and four chairs kitchen including microwave and a breakfast bar area we had a seperate bedroom with king bed and there was three large wardrobes the bathroom had a shower there were two televisions and a safe in the room there s a laundrette and an outdoor swimming pool we would not hesitate to recommend this to others and certainly would be willing to return ourselves as we were very impressed

suite location although the room is a little dated having the kitchenette was nice for our family of 4 and the hotel location couldn t be better the parking and internet access are included which is a plus the hotel also has a pool and laundry room we only stayed 2 nites  79 nite for jr suite  but if were staying longer would get a full suite  with full kitchen and microwave  we missed not having a microwave in the kitchenette it is a good value for a suite in a sweet location and would not hesitate to stay here again

very disappointed did we stay at the same place after reading all of the reviews i expcated a lot more from this place i actually wondered if we were staying in the same place i agee with eveyone the location is wonderful could t ask for a better location in addition it also offered free parking and internet access the room was dated carpet was worn and it smelled of stale smoke i did not feel it was clean as a matter of fact the shower curtain had black mildew all over the back the windowsill in the bathroom was just filled with dirt and the placemat on the kitchen table had dried ketchup stuck on it we had a double queen suite on the back bed the there was a hole in the bottom sheet large enough my husbands foot kept getting stuck in it finally the pillows were just awful i was very disappointed and will never stay here again

great location well equiped suites right in the middle of hollywood steps to graumanns and kodak theater we had lots of room comfortable unit but showing its age great price  about 70 night would stay there again
noisy but nice

great value since reading the reveiws here prompted me to stay at the hotel i feel i should contribute i will just be repeating what many others have said price is great  location behind the kodak theatre  close to everything you need room was very big and very clean staff was really very very friendly and helpful  property is very secure parking is free  free wireless access to the internet use of a pc in the lobby if you don t have a laptopthis hotel is a great value

great value and location my wife and i attended a seminar in west hollywood their suggested hotels were over 150 00 per night being on a limited budget we searched elsewhere we saw hollywood orchid suites on tripadvisor and decided to try it for about 71 00 per night we were pleasantly surprised the hollywood orchid suites was an old apartment building so each suite has a bedroom which is similar to a normal hotel room and a separate full kitchen the closets were generous and the bathroom was average they had heat in the bathroom and the exhaust fan actually was effective my wife loves that the balcony was nice touch with a table and chairs the hotel was old and dated but very neat and clean the pool was spotless the desk help had no personality but was very helpful and knowledgable of the area and the best route back to the airport i loved the free secure underground parking rain is no problem the location is great if you want to visit the chinese theater you can walk their is no breakfast but pick up some groceries on the way and put them in the full size refrigerator overall it is an excellent value and we would stay their again

good value but service could be better we booked a suite months in advance for a family of five despite this the sofa bed did not have any sheets provided  when these were requested from reception i was almost called a liar other bedding provided was inadequate as it was cold  the heater did not work in general the person on reception was rude throughout our stay apart from its cental location with free parking  the room being clean i would be reluctant to stay here again purely because of the poor service
great hollywood hotel

big but not beautiful the hotel rooms were large but very dated and worn the beds were extremely hard and the kitchen looked clean but looking closely you wouldn t want to eat much there the air conditioners and plumbing were both very noisy it was very easy to hear adjoining neighbors and we could even see one man showering from the hallway    head up of course on the plus side the pool was nice  no spa and the location is good it is behind the kodak theatre so you have zero view but walking distance to all of the hollywood blvd sites staff was courteous and helpful

another great stay orchid suites continues to be a great bargain in a prime hollywood location i ve stayed here with family members two years in a row and would certainly return rooms are large with  in many cases a wellequipped full kitchen underground parking is safe secure and convenient pool is a pleasant diversion and wellmaintained i noticed a problem with a loose spotlight in the pool this year reported it to the front desk and was impressed to see it fixed in a matter of hours at some hotels that type of problem means closing the pool for days at a stretch the rooftop garden sunning spot is a great place to relax and watch the activity below the only minor problem this year was with a noisy neighbor above us when i mentioned it to the front desk they asked the family to take another room on the first floor problem solved staffers are friendly helpful and wellinformed we left a video cord behind this year and they tracked it down and mailed it to us at no charge overall a great stay and a great bargain i highly recommend it

hotel not so good location great i chose hollywood orchid hotel for the location i thought it was going to be alot better by reading other peoples reviews online not so in my case i was told i would get a room with a view and i got a view of a wall the shower s drain wouldn t stay up so i had to turn off the water to soap up my handicap mother who was with me for mother s day couldn t even use the shower because of this parking underground great but if you leave in the evening you won t be parking in the underground garage when you come back  parking very limited i had a coupon for 65 for 2 beds kitchette they said they couldn t honor the price due to weekend so i had to pay 79  90 total  and still had to give them the coupon for that price the place was old and run down i brought my own sheets and blanket which really helped me deal with this place the only thing good about this place is the location you walk underneath the renaissance hotel and your right at the hollywood blvd outside mall kodak theatre and manns chinese theatre if you don t care where you sleep then here s your place personally i would spend a extra few bucks a get a better hotel the roosevelt is just is close and you can get good deals online stay away from room 302 bad    the indians indonesians that run the hotel are nice but don t give a  if something goes wrong in your room sorry is all you ll get
recommended welllocated friendly and helpful staff reasonable rates very nice pool area i liked this hotel a lot

tragically hip trying hard but leaves room to be desired the hotel is located a quick walk s away from the bustling downtown area in westwood so the location is good the staff is very friendly and work hard to make your experience pleasurable however the hotel is trying so hard to be hip that it doesn t always seem to cater to the needs of average people for example my bathroom was tiny the rest of the room was fine except the bathroom was so small that there was no place to place my dopp kit also the gym is very underwhelming for a hotel in this price range the food options are limited but that s expected for a w property all in all it s a fine place to stay especially given the limited choices in westwood just don t expect too much
great hotel location amenities staff everything

a disappointing they tried to make some w hotels with an old building actually you get old noisy ac despite the fact you get suites bedrooms are small the swimming pool is tiny and there is no shower around   it takes a while to get your order at the restaurant for your breakfast and to summarize you feel that the management is poor in this location

worst w i ve ever stayed in my wife and i are big fans of w hotels we ve stayed in about 6 different ones my wife was 9 months pregnant so i decided to treat her to a last weekend in a suite at the w in los angeles  needed to stay in la in case she went into labor  we got the spectaular suite and were so disappointed the suite is divided into two rooms making them both pretty small instead of one big suite it was also very dark lastly the artwork and accesories around the room seemed cheap  many cb2 vases and such  definitley not up to w quality it turns out that this w is actually a conversion of an old hotel which is probably a big reason for this w s problems the service was very good but the restaurants were very average and very expensive we ate there the first night and spent 140 despite only having one drink we were pissed as there are lots of restaurants in la we would have love to go to for less than that it seemed like everything there was more expensive than other w s but maybe i m wrong the spa is great and was the highlight for us expensive but a great experience the pool wasn t that great which was a big bummer for my wife the lounges weren t comfortable and the cabanas were a joke lastly for those of you who don t know westwood it is pretty lame not too many good restaurants this location would not be good if you want to walk to good restaurants bars shopping the bars in the hotel are ok but the crowd is not not hip just cheesy if you are visiting la do not stay here lots of other better cheaper better located hotels

won t be back just wanted to let you know about our stay we usually stay at the renaissance in west hollywood comparing the w to the renaissance i would give the w a c and the renaissance an a this was our very first time using starwood pointse have been loyal marriott rewards people for many years when we arrived at the w the bellman encouraged me to go check in and leave my bags there for him i was concerned that the luggage and the loose bag and sweatshirts would get separated with several guys doing the work sure enough as i was checking in i saw the cart come in and the loose items weren with my luggage he said h i was wondering who they belonged tobr >we checked in on points the reservationist gave us a room directly across from the elevators which we heard loud and clear from our room to comparen our points at the renaissance or any marriott they usually upgrade us and always make sure that we have a fabulous location and room the bellman was not busy but i was told to go ahead to the room and wait for my bags wait is just what i did feeling that there was absolutely no reason to wait since it wasn busy at all downstairs i called the front desk to request that the bags be brought up soon at the renaissance the bellman waits while you check in and then follows you in the same elevator to your room with your bags no waiting necessary the rooms were very inadequate for traveler needs it as if the hotel never did an analysis of basics that traveler need there was no place around the sink to put anything except a toothbrush and the toothpaste there was no makeup table and mirror the closets were tiny and there were no dresser drawers big enough to lay more clothes in them except for the small ones in the closet at the renaissance in fact at every marriott there is always a makeup area with a mirror there are always large dresser drawers the sink area has plenty of room to lay out your toiletries i called for the concierge and the operator put me on hold  with my permission  but then she came back on the line sounding very flustered and asked if she could take a message for the concierge surprise the concierge never called me back at the renaissance the operators never get flustered in fact they always say elighted when we went down to the pool late sat afternoon it was crowded and there wasn a seat to be had we let the guy there know of our predicament i think he had several optionsirst he could have let us use one of the cabanas that were free since it was so late in the afternoon and there were no signs of it being occupied second he could have watched us go to the bar and come and got us when some chairs became free there was no follow up needless to say we won be back

fun the w westwood is a great place wonderfull rooms with nice view good service and with a special swing we enjoyed it the location is great  the bar staff are a bit less on a friday or saturday evening when the seem to be catering a a specila  plastic and shallow lalaland crowd and forget about the hotel guests only after ordering 3 drinks they seem to except you and become friendly and start to give the service one may expect still a place to return to nicely modern with a fresh style the area alos offers nice bars restaurants and shops

disgusting food we went to the restaurant nine thirty which was empty  should ve seen the signs on a tuesday night the mixed green salad was made with old lettuce leaves and tiny so we sent it back the snapper wasn t even cooked through  it was not meant to be seared and was very tough so we had to send it back for them to actually cook it it came back 20 minutes later spongey and tasteless so our dinner ended up being greasy brussell sprouts and broccoli our waiter left half way through dinner then a new one came to introduce himself then the old one came back they didn t offer to comp our overpriced meal  34 00 for the snapper that we did not eat   and we tried to complain on the way out but the hostess was nowhere to be found to top things off i waited forever for my car at valet it was the most horrible dining experience i have had in los angeles

horrible restaurant service and management i celebrated my birthday in the hotel s restaurant i called them to confirm if there is any charge for serving the cake i bring in they said i shouldn t worry the cutting is complimentary at the end of the nigth they charged me 5 person for the cake when i mentioned this to the manager he had an attitude and i ended up paying 50 extra also there are 2 restaurants in the hotel which i didn t know in the beginning 1st i made a reservation for 6 people and when i called them to increase the reservation to 10 people and the girl on the phone took my credit card  because it is necessary for reservation over 8 people i know that it is normal but when i went to the restaurant there was a reservation for 6 people and they didn t know who took my card  also they checked the other restaurant too but there was no reservation over there too what a serious management we spent 700 in the restaurant and it was a horrible and slow service i guess too many people are trying to get in the restaurant that s why they don t care to please you they just want to take your money i am not going back there again
average used to stay here since it was the only hotel in westwood they let you know they were the only choice not so great service employees have an attitude

wonderful stay my husband mother and i stayed at this property for my daughter s ucla law school graduation we had requested an early check in and were given our rooms at an even earlier time than requested the staff was friendly attentive and helpful as starwood members we were given an upgrade on one of our rooms to a beautilful large suite which was perfect for our needs as we were able to have a little pregraduation celebration the hotel is situated extremely close to the ucla campus and it made it easy to get to the ceremony my only complaint would be that their complimentary car service which delivered us to the campus stopped running at 500 and we had to call a cab to get back to the hotel but that was a minor inconvenience all in all the hotel was perfect for our needs and made a memorable and exciting day even better

professional not snotty i had been here already a few times a few years ago before the renovation of the rooms and things are going better room was big hip and comfortable staff is professional although things went a bit wrong at check in and check out and although trying to act cool not snotty whatsoever the thirtynine restaurant is nice the pool area a bit small location is ideal if you want to be central in la although nothing is going on in this neighbourhood prices are reasonable if you look at the quality in general a good choice for travellers that feel young

wonderful choice for la we are discriminating travelers and so always worry when we try a new hotel we were on our way to the desert with our children  ages 12 and 17 and wanted to stop in la for a night anyway we arrived at 700p and were promptly greeted by the parkers upon checking in we asked to have both rooms nearby which was not available so angel at the front desk was so kind to upgrade us as spg clients to a full 2bedroom suite that evening we dined at the hotel s restaurant 930 and had jeffrey a wonderful waiter while the food and wine was pricey all five of us enjoyed our meal and the incredible service the room was contemporary but comfortable with nice flat screen tv s in every room  even the bathroom and bliss products we only had a few complaints the bottled water was 9    how silly the parking was 31    why not include it even though the bathroom is large it is not welldesigned as there is no area for makeup hair brush etc and the makeup mirror is right next to the shower door finally the air conditioner knocked in the morning which needs to be addressed the bellman are extremely kind and they got the bill exactly right we d stay there again

yuck i ll start by saying i was here for business not pleasure my business associate had booked us to stay here very pretentious and the entire wing we were staying in smelled of marijuana it fired up in the evenings i told the front desk but they did nothing to hunt down the culprits this place definitely caters to the tragically hip not my cup of tea

worth every cent my husband and i had to be at ucla for his cancer treatment and wanted to be very close to the campus we looked at several places online but decided on the w the hotel is very modern which is not my taste  however everything is done extremely well the service is excellent and when i checked in tracy morgan of 30 rock was in line in front of me the w is just a few blocks from the ucla campus and within walking distance of the westwood theater and shopping district we are part of the starwood network and because of this we were upgraded to a suite on the 6th floor the short version not the cheapest hotel in the area but worth every cent if you want to be treated like a celebrity

very good experience i stayed here for one week and i had a wonderful experience as a gold star member i was upgraded and my room was huge they have recently renovated the place and it is tasteful and trendy the service was friendly the rooms were very clean the only reason that i didn t give it a 5 is because the walls are somewhat thin  especially when you have a group of noisy women staying next door security was prompt when getting them to turn down their music but nothing could be done about the thin wall and noisy ladies i would recommend this hotel to anyone who can afford it

building great staff awful we ve stayed here probably 40 nights just this year and so we have a variety of experience here basically i love the location very convient and the hotel design is lovely as is the pool area the rooms are fantastic the service however is horrible they never get your reservations right and we are platinum spg members they also kind of don t do anything but stand around wearing black clothes if design made a four star hotel then this would be one but service is important too they never make the rooms on time and you have to beg them to come if you call for a bellhop be prepared to wait at least an hour as we did last time we also had issues of smoke coming through the floors from smoking rooms into our rooms in three different rooms really an issue and if you are facing the back of the building be prepared to hear all night frat parties from ucla if they had a topnotch staff if would be awesome but they don t
surprised with a fantastic stay       nice pool scene for drinks and lunging

wonderful w located in an assuming neighborhood the w provides chic elegance to westwood you walk in and are welcomed by doorman and asked if there is anything that they can assist you with this sets the precedence for the rest of your stay the rooms are clean and modern but doesn t lack comfort the beds are the starwood staple of the wonderful bed which are in fact wonderful the suites have two flatscreens  one in the living room one in the bedroom as well as a cd player with their w cd provided for your listening enjoyment the bathrooms are extremely clean  i notice every fleck of dirt and the robes are very soft i placed the breakfast card out at 1am for fresh coffee and a bagel to be delivered at 815 at 815 a smiling waiter arrived at my door and was very accomodating this is a hotel that likes to please their guests we had drinks at the backyard by the pool upon arrival and were served strong mai tais and a lady drink of some sort all with a smile we also had drinks at whiskey blue after dinner and were greated again with accomodation the bouncer went out of his way to find us a nice table so we can watch all the people go by the w doesn t disappoint with the man candy all these male waiters bartenders who are very easy on the eyes   my husband said there was eye candy for him too  allinall the w westwood does not disappoint

chic elegance this is a nice hotel that is a bit over priced the suite i got is very chic with an urban flare the bed was very nice and wonderful the entire hotel was super clean and chic it lives up to the w hotel reputation what i did find to be issues were the bath towels they were too average the lack of a coffee machine in the room was another issue because you are almost forced to buy the over priced coffee and muffins in the restaurant the pool area is wonderful but the pool itself is too small for the resort it s more like a pond having to pay 31 00 for overnight valet parking was another issue street parking is rare in this area due to westwood village and ucla being right in the vicinity overall i liked the westwood la hotel w regardless of the overpriced coffee drinks at the bar and valet parking i would return if the price was right

excellent hotel very nice hotel in a more quiet residential neighbourhood but within walking distance of shops restaurants cafes the hotel was under construction renovating the rooms stayed in a newly renovated room very nice rooms bathroom was on the small side but very nice the restaurant and bar downstairs were also great good food excellent service i d absolutely stay again one of the nicer w s i ve stayed in the pool area is nice quiet good service there as well you ve probably seen the pool on tv it s used in a number of shows they were filming a show  1 day while we were there

fab stay at the w my husband and i plus teenage daughter stayed for three nights at the w and had a very enjoyable stay we had a newly refurbished suite on the 14th floor which was extremely spacious and well designed found the staff to be very helpful and enjoyed hanging out in the backyard overall experienced a very relaxing stay in a quiet and safe location of west hollywood easy access by car to many of the touristy spots including 20 minute drive to santa monica if you want somewhere local to eat recommend tengu the sushi restaurant which is about 5 minutes away all in all most enjoyable stay and would consider staying again

what you expect good fro being hip and bad fro the same readon the w hotels are all modeleld similialy active bars for the young hip stylish   and this one la  read hollywood si no different friday and saturday nights are scene so you you are not part of the scene avoid the street facing rooms on these nights these rooms are wonderful  all suites providing you with a separate living area tolieltries by bliss which is special complimentary cofee tea facilities but do anything else and there goes you arm and leg fitness area small but functionable staff friendly and helpful one f the worse hings of ths w is the elevators  every doubel i have stayed out in the us  over 12    you wait forever    i doubt get it  this w is on a quite street near holloywood and just bolcks away from westwood village  but in the nieghoborhood area quite but is close to everything and for a great dinner walk 1 2 block donw the street to teng for some wonderful sushi rolls <class>positive

over rated  i have always like the starwood hotels so it was a easy choice to try the w hotel in la we pulled up to the hotel and was impressed with the service and our first impression of the hotel was fantastic only to find out while checking in that they gave our room away so we ended up being upgraded to a bigger room it didn t help the fact that one of us still had to sleep on the dreaded pull out couch the room was impressive except for the greasy mark on the wall and stained couch my girlfriend woke up the next morning with bug bites all over her neck arms legs and stomach  we were absolutely disgusted     i think i have said enough i m sure others had a pleasent experience i however refuse to stay at that hotel ever again

true los angeles experience we decided to stay here for two nights even though the reviews were less than sparkling first of all this is a wonderful hotel if you prefer the stylings of a holiday inn   do not stay here if you are looking for something different and luxurious then stay here while we were here there was a designer sample sale  which my wife loved and a taping of the hbo show entourage that s what this hotel is hollywood mixed with high style our room was perfect a super comfortable living area  couch tv desk bar area and an intimate separate bedroom the hotel is located in a private residential neighborhood away from the noise of the city my one complaint is the elevators  they take forever i found this to be something that is constant in california hotels   anyway i m not sure where some of these other reviewers were staying but we truly enjoyed the w

shabby chic or just shabby and chic i stayed at the w westwood for one night i got a great deal on a room that was very spacious and well appointed but very dirty the couches and carpets had stains etc on balance i could ve put up with it if it weren t so darn far from downtown i was there for work and the drive to downtown la from westwood was a nightmare in the morning beware if this is for business travel the bar was very busy on saturday night the scene was more obnoxious than hip but it was a scene nonetheless
pretty good hotel is ok rooms are clean front desk is ok for the price i would stay somewhere else next time location is in a residential district you need a car to get to anywhere

once again beat up and tired hallways and room are best summed up as having the appearance of 30 years of spring break cavorting without a cleaning stains on all walls carpets and furniture typical dark w hallways and rooms poor towels overpriced water  8 per bottle  staff with attitude at the front desk car valets were very good flies join you for your beakfast without invite food stains all over the restaurant menus each time the last three stays 3 25 surcharge for using the atm and limited to 100  what will 100 buy you at a w hotel  well below expectation for a starwood hotel do yourself a favour bring lysol or stay somewhere else instead of taking photos of guests in the elevators they should video their cleaning staff to determine what they have been doing the us disease control unit should be called into this overpriced dormitory

wow what a let down      upon arrival i felt let down as the car service had no drive to pull into we were rushed from curbside into our hotel    once up the stairs the doorman offered help with our bags   too little too late plus every calorie burnt is one not on my hips   okay so stay with my ramble    at the desk i was greeted by a snotty girl about 5 years my junior and very grumpy    we made our way to our room which was ready early as requested and down free due to allergies i complement them on this   but since there was no air and i had to change rooms three more times to find a room with working air their small triumph meant nothing to me in the end now in my newest room it took nearly two hours for hotel staff to get the down items out prior to bringing my allergy stricken mate into the room i would like to say he slept peacefully in the old room without a working ac but it was near the closet where they were working on the system and the workers were talking loudly on their phone outside our room   did i mention we came in on a redeye and were just trying to get a nap in prior to a social event that eveninge just wanted to get some sleep alreadyhen while awaiting the staff i sat on the sofa in my newest room staring out the window    i noticed a bullet hole in the glass    on the twelfth floor but howit had come from in the room   scary stuff   guns generally do not go off where i reside     i will stop this rant here where the room is finally ready the air is finally working and i open the drawer to the ikea dresser only to have the face plate land on my foot     what a let down   but if you ask for the ucla rate   not discount you will save a little if you too are forced to stay here

so arrogant  hello is me who is paying  ok i cant say the hotel is terrible but is a w and so expensive and it looks a little old    nothing special nor great i stayed for a week when must of people stays for a couple of days so i was paying more than 3 000 and as i was paying with cash they want me to leave them 2 000 more just in case    the staff was so arrogant as they were the ones who were paying the 3 000 and they were never useful    will stay there again only for the location you can walk to ucla

never again the room was ok clean and comfortable and also 370 for the cheapest one looks like a 1 bedroom luxury apt however you touch anything in that room and there goes at least 30 from your card even if it s just a bottle of water and even if you tell them not to charge you before they make a contact so one minus there second i wanted to take a shower but couldn t because it took me too long to figure out where the f   is hot water knob or level or button or whatever the hell they use to make the cold water become warm well i m 32 and i m an it professional you d figure a guy like me can figure out the whole navigations system in bmw 6 series in less than 10 minutes but here i m trying to figure out how to turn on the hot water so i gave up after almost a minute of freezing my but there second minus now i m trying to reach them to figure out why did they charge me 50 for and naturally you won t get live person you have to leave a message nice try people usually give up when they have to leave a message for something like this well not me certainly i m not going there ever again have fun
