great 1st impression that doesn t follow through stayed at the w for one night on a corporate account  thank goodness because if i paid full price i would have been outraged the hotel is dazzling at first glance  the glowing blue steps to the front door beautiful lobby lounge spaces friendly frontdesk staff free wireless internet in the lobby etc which is exactly what i expected having always heard great things about w hotels it s the rooms  suites really that truly disappoint after a slow elevator ride you step off into a dimly lit hallway with uneven flooring under the carpet the space itself is also dimly lit  even the bathrooms  so if you arrive after dark  as i did it s hard to tell how dingy things really are by the light of day i could see gouges in the furniture  maybe they should rethink their dogfriendly policy  many mystery stains in the bathroom floor and more in all the bathroom was the worst part the tub had a very slow drain so i showered standing in dirty water the light on the makeup mirror  which would have been a welcome touch was broken as a business traveler i was also disappointed by the almost total lack of electrical outlets in my suite  except for one in the bathroom they had been covered over with blank plates it s not the end of the word to charge my laptop and phone in the bathroom but it did seem weird from my limited experience there are better hotels in similarly convenient places at equivalent costs in l a i will not choose to book at the w again
nice but i d expected more       one bedroom suite view 1

great location    bad room no question this hotel is in an awesome location the lobby is awesome and attracts quite the crowd the positive traits stop as you have to wait for the very slow elevators the rooms are the worst attempt of a remodel i ve seen at a w the room had nothing special except the heavenly bed the bathrooms  which is something i always like to be plush was horrible standard size tub shower and it didn t even have the rounded shower curtain rod to give more space the countertop and faucets were the same that were installed when this property was a ramada inn or equal room service was very prompt and courteous the bliss spa was very nice as well this is a great place to see celebrities and enjoy the location however the room itself leave much to be desired

good bad and indifferent oh to be young and decadent the w la is a classic example of style over substance in that regard it is perfect the w caters to the hip and beautiful los angelenos with nothing better to do than posture at the poolside there is enough silicone around that pool to float a battleship it makes for pleasant people watching but try not to stare too much the hotel itself is ok frankly the decor is getting a little tired if not downright cliche the room  a mega suite penthouse was filthy upon our arrival the bathroom had lots of detritus from the previous occupants there was food on the carpet next to the couch the second bathtub had muddy footprints in it etc the service folks are certainly cheerful if not particularly helpful their trademark anything anytime catchphrase is laughable the utterly inept valets are either a too busy checking out the hot women or b too busy thinking about their screenplay to bother getting your car for you there are waaaaay better places to stay in la although the location is great if you need to be on the west side i would not stay here again too much money for too little service and too much attitude for suite accomodations i would strongly recommend a bungalow at the fairmont miramar before i came back to the w

great hotel great location after many trips to la for biz  pleasure i discovered the westwood area and the w while staying here on business for the la film festival after staying at the w for the whole 10 days of the festival and three subsequent stays i have to say it s a really great hotel i travel 70 for biz and this is one of the best hotels i ve stayed at in la i don t know where all the negative reviews come from the valet bell and doormen remember my name everytime i come check in is quick and a bellman is right with you when you go to your room the first time i stayed there the room i got had just been painted and didn t care for the smell called them up and they sent up a bellman with keys to a new room and moved my bags they usually call the room about 30 minutes after check in to see if everything is to your liking it is an older hotel but all rooms are suites of various sizes and twice was upgraded to a larger suite the beds and pillows are extremely comfy and better than most hotels i ve stayed at the work area is very large and bathrooms are nice the backyard pool lounge area is very nice nice green lush area that seems to be miles away from la  except for the occasional ucla medical helicopter  cabanas are open for the taking food and drinks are very good and you may run into an occasional celebrity hanging out for a drink the food at 930 restaurant is also very good whicky blue is also cool to hang out for a couple of drinks valet parking is kind of pricey tho the location is great it s in a quiet residential area but is only a couple of blocks from westwood village s many restaraunts theatres  shops as well as a longs ralphs best buy and of course ucla it s an easy 2030 minutes down wilshire to santa monica  even in rush hour and close to sunset for those drives out to hollywood be careful of jaywalking in westwood village they will ticket you try the pineapple infused sake down the street at tengu

very unimpressed i was very excited to stay at this hotel but by the end of our stay i could not wait to leave and never stay there again due to numerous service issues the staff at this hotel in literally every department is unable to successfully complete a task you ask of them without screwing something up everything was a challenge for them to get right the pool attendants are never around when you need them and take forever once you have placed your order and don t seem remotely concerned when you ask them 5 times for that drink menu you asked for 30 minutes ago or they messed up your drink order we thought that for a hotel of it s size the pool is completely inadequate and way too small for the number of guests it was literally teeming with children everytime we tried to relax there our room was not very nice and had musty smell to it it felt like no one paid attention to things like chipped paint on all the furniture or burnt out light bulbs in the room i think a great hotel pays attention to those details the majority of the hotel excluding the lobby which is very nice had a run down feeling to it and the hallways on all the floors where dark and musty and personally i thought a little creepy these are just my experiences but i would not bother with this hotel and stay at one of the luxury boutique type hotels where they actually know how to do things right good luck

the w is way cool had an awesome stay at the hip and happening w last weekend the service was impeccable the food was delectable and nothing beats hanging out at the pool with a cool cocktail love that they are hidden away from the maddening crowd but still close to lots of hot spots but recommend booking ahead at their spa bliss  i couldn t get in all weekend

location is it all the bad things you read in other reviews are true there are 3 good things about this hotel  it s location it s pet policy  allows them and it s food in room dining everything else is relying on the w s from other places to get it customers there is no housekeeping  no robes then after they delivered them they took one away the next day and it never returned did not service at all one day and left us with no tp no tissues ever reappeared in the box the featherbed was half way down the bed one night  lumpy  and had to be remade by me then the bed was short sheeted the next  i had to remake my bed every night didn t get fresh towels one day or floor mat the next or any bath mats at all the next it has the noisiest toilets i ve ever heard in any accomodations  they really shriek and you have to plug your ears in the all hardscape bath it is an older building so guest room and hallway noise are bad although there is almost no street noise there is much from the music at the private parties they hold at the pool they also screwed up my bill had the name sort of right  not the sex but the address and the starwood preffered number wrong  i corrected them but still don t have my points if it wasn t for the location it would ve died by now because it s way to pricey for the lack of service

terrible terrible service i stayed at the w hotel in los angeles and received terrible service they lost my reservation and refused to accomodate any basic requests i made i was treated with an aloof attitude and the employees seemed to believe that they were the customers there and didnt seem to care about making the actual customers feel welcome and at home nor were they providing a level of service you might expect at this hotel they seemed to try to convey an image of cool that came across as cold and aloof coupled with a  better than thou attitude a miserable experience

great rooms poor service all rooms are suites and well decorated but the staff is not serviceoriented on my third stay there they gave me a room next to the gym despite the fact that i am a gold member i had to pull tooth and nail to have my room changed the guy had lied about the hotel being full after i requested valet service to bring out my car the guy downstairs insisted that he calls the front desk obviously thinking that i was stealing the car  despite the fact that i had already supplied my room and valet ticket numbers  when i complained to a manager he was at least courteous and admitted that he could not offer a good explanation he remedied the situation by giving me courtesy points obviously i am deeply disappointed but i will give the hotel another try on my next business trip in la   they need to shape up and the staff needs to drop their poor attitude

professionally mediocre my wife and i had a reservation for 7 318 2 2005 on a first leg of 10day vacation of lavegasbay area swing but checked out early 8 1 morning headed to anaheim 279 nite may not buy much in the area but doesn t seem justified the room was a plain small suite shabby but o k the bathroom is big and seems to be the suite s only best feature the rest is below average both in shape and deco the lobby is dark and the hallway has this colorful art deco that looks shabby and old i recon that some folks may like them but i imagine not many room s view was a back of hotel s another wing in about 15 feet away spa construction was going on as a concrete breaker making piercing noise from 7 am ish sat  albeit a note of appology on it slipped through the door in the morning  i told you officially and now you should bear with it   broadband internet access never worked with hotel s remote tech support person finally acknowledging that it s out of mission hotelwide due to be fixed on monday an wasted staff front desk valet parking are courteous lone conciergie was unapproachable and busy yakking locationwas great but i doubt i would come back to this hotel i complained to the hotel and at the w site the response have been always courteous and cookiecut apologetic but i didn t get impression from them trying to improve

an awesome experience i am surprised by all the negative reviews about the w i stayed there from wednesday through friday during a job interview and it was amazing first i called the day before to let them know that i would arriving around 1pm and that i wanted my room to be ready even though that was before checkin the receptionist was very polite and when i arrived the next day my room was ready just as promised my room was on the fifth floor the farthest possible from the elevator with a beautiful view of the pool it was quiet and larger than many apartments i ve lived in the bliss spa products were great and the room was clean and wellappointed one evening i called for a wakeup call at 5 am when i awoke before 5 the next morning i called to cancel it the operator immediately asked if i d like breakfast brought up to my room when i ordered i asked for it to be delivered at 545 and it was right on time the staff was friendly and pleasant and the breakfasts were delicious i think the things that really made the stay a perfect one were 1 call ahead if you re arriving early so your room will be ready on time2 ask for a quiet room away from the elevators3 be prepared to soak in the cool vibe of this hotel it s over the top but totally entertaining

wonderful time at the w i enjoyed my stay at the w hotel in the westwood area of los angeles i got to the hotel at 1230pm a few hours before normal check in so the room they had for me was not ready they asked if i minded being put in a handicap accessible room i did not mind at all the room was spacious and very nice i did not have a robe and had to ask twice at the front desk for one the restaurant in the hotel nine thirty had amazing food with reasonable prices i enjoyed my stay

gone way downhill i ve been staying here at least five times a year for the last four or so years and i m finally giving up on the w they are clearly spending too much time booking video launch parties with d list nobodies to cater to their returning guests the bar grill by the pool is beautiful but the service is consistently terrible regardless of occupancy last time i was there valet parking lost the keys to my car requiring me to take a taxi the front desk is staffed by very attractive people who must be doing well with the acting gigs because they certainly aren t focused on their day jobs as for room service the last time i ordered my celery was stale and when i called to mention this they apologized but made zero offer to correct it s too bad because i love the location  tengu down the street has great sushi

had fun at the w pretty cool hotel stayed for a few days in midjuly  had a blast the barwhiskey blue rocks it s kinda uber trendy and exclusive but since i had a room i had no problems it was pretty funny watching all the clubbers wait in line for hours to get in when i zipped right by them lots of hot people all over spotted a couple of celebrities here and there room was good on the 6th floor internet worked great great staff overall   no issues restaurant wasn t bad as in other reviews but not exactly over the top like i thought it would be but nonetheless great food  great service love the socal weather and dining outside checkin out was a snap great doorguys and valets   always ready with directions i ll definitely spend next summer at the w when i m back in la

worst experience in los angeles ever no sleep possible the w westwood can not be compared to the other w sister hotels the mysterious white stains on the furniture were bad enough let alone the rotten dehydrated vegeatbles left on the shelves of the bar in my room i paid 28 00 for parking to have my car parked mysteriously off site when they were hosting one of their numerous events i was told they would need at least a 45 minute warning to retrieve my vehicle i was kept awake for three nights straight from the screaming whooping and cheering coming from the bar  lobby lounge when i complained to the manager on duty they asked me what they could do their suggestion was a pair of earplugs really nice they said that they were trying to draw the fine line of being a business hotel that hosted events and that they did not realize the event would be so large the music from the bar continued to escalate until the wee hours i replied that maybe they should focus on some soundproofing for the hotel when we finally did get to sleep at 3 a m we were woken up again by security calling my room to ask me where the party was at in the hotel i replied it was in the lobby and how insightful they were i checked out early the next morning word of warning stay clear of this hotel the rooms view food service amenities are all horrible

really bad my husband and i have been staying at this hotel every other month for the past couple of years it happens to be convenient to where we need to be when we are in la and we like the fact that it is all suites many many times we have sworn that this is the last time and then we give it one more shot this last stay finally did it check in took an hour and a half we were given five different rooms that were wrong  a lesser category on then what we were being charged for and when we were finally given the correct room it had an un mage bed if this is the way they treat repeat guests with starwood gold status i can only imagine how they treat everyone else

loved this place my husband and i loved this hotel it felt like our own little apartment it was clean and well furnished the staff was personable especially the valet guys who were always there to give us directions and information nice touch having a dvd player in the room cool la decor the only complaint i have is the shape of the sink in the bathroom cool to look at but impractical  splashed up at you

great rooms iffy service great rooms  i had 2 lounges    a large bedroom good location noisy bar  make sure you get a room above floor 5 and pref on the pool view side  staff were great on the phone but for some reason quite snooty when talking to guests face to face nowhere nearby to park overnight so you will most likely have to use the expensive valet parking

w stands for what a mistake i am only gving 1 mark because this site will not allow minus marks what a terrible hotel nice room great bed that is it no service no restaurants no knowledge of what package i booked no responsibility no remorse this should return to a dorm because it is a waste as a hotel shame on you starwood hollywood hype is fine we all expect a little but this is blatant misrepresentation please all lawyers stay so you can start a class action against them for breach of contract do not i beg give the w anymore illgotten goods from the public

loved it i stayed at w los angeles for three nights and brought 10 of my clients with me over an award show the hotel was sold out and very busy so we had very high expectations considering the inflated rates over this busy period we had an amazing time and the  was totally worth it we usually stay at the four seasons or the l ermitage but a colleague had raved about the w so we tried it what can i say service wonderful location very secluded and away from the beverly hills drama  and traffic  celebrity sightings everywhere from the cabanas by the pool to the bar i am not sure why some of the reviews here are so negative  hey it s la   people don t have attitude they just all want to be the best and best looking  and what s wrong with that    we also did not care that we didn t get any special upgrades although our rates were 300 all rooms are suites and since the weather is gorgeous who needs more than a one bedroom suite anyway i actually want to commend the hotel for hiring staff that is very helpful friendly and good looking more power to them like i said we had a wonderful time and will stay here everytime and tell all my friends and coworkers to forget about high tea and ancient butlers at the stuffy four seasons and live it up at the ultraglam w with some sassy martinis and sexy staff

liar liar i brought 14 people to this hotel for 9 days half of them were clients i was assured that we would be thrilled with the hotel and it s service since we were paying for a total of 126 room nights my expectations were high i was promised special rooms for 3 of my party instead i had to fight with the staff for the promised upgrades the new it restuarant never opened the elevators took 15 minutes to arrive i can not even imagine how awful the safety is for the guests the lobby is pitch black and people are just wandering in and out with noone paying any attention to who was going where the rooms were dirty and every morning your shower filled up to your ankles with water that won t drain back to the four seasons

will never return we stayed here for three nights first we were very happy that the front desk assigned us a room on the top floor facing the pool we soon realized this was a big mistake our top floor room was very close to the main compressor with the airconditioning not working in our room  the front desk told us it was broken and couldn be fixed  we were forced to sleep with the window open we tried to fall asleep but the super loud noise from the compressor made it impossible in addition our room only had one dinning room chair for both of us to relax   also the wall was thin    also it costs 35 00 for overnight parking    we can go on and on about this hotel the quality of the services and the standard of the rooms for wla are not even three stars

hated it don t bother wasting your money on this one overpriced  overrated the staff have their noses in the air and couldn t care less about customer service i was stuck in a room with a malfunctioning shower and couldn t be moved as the hotel was full

disgraceful some of the staff were very kind and helpful but this hotel was a complete waste of money the rooms are adequate but the walls are paper thin the traffic noise from outside is terrible  no double glazing and it was especially disappointing to hear the staff cleaning the nextdoor room at midnight with the stereo on fulltilt the pool staff are hilariously bad way too cool to actually do their job and find somewhere for you to sit  prefer to just grunt at people and tell people where they can t sit reading other reviews it seems to be a regular occurrence to close the swimming pool and the bar down for private events leaving nowhere for the guests to go indeed when we stayed there a couple of weeks ago the whole hotel was taken over by a film crew and we were even banished from the lobby  would never go back the w hotel in san diego is decent though

expensive with attitude  plain and simple   overpriced  restaurant bar is being renovated which is by far the best reason to stay here it normally has great atmosphere and good drinks albeit expensive however on this stay hotel staff kept their renovation quiet staff seem to have a chip on their shoulder pool area is nice place to have a drink hotel rooms are full of amenities but room had a  curious smell and mini fridge did not work overall would recommend to visit the bar for a cocktail but stay somewhere cheaper

something special on a recent business trip i was upgraded to an incredible 2bed 2bath suite with an office and a huge lounge area as i was interviewing people the following day this was invaluable the staff were especially friendly and very efficient the location of the hotel in a quiet neighbourhood is perfect for getting away from the bustle of the city but it s close enough to many of the fun parts of l a to make it a good base

alternative scene if you want a very cool la place to stay the w is great but i found it cold and empty and sterile drinks are overpriced  12 martinis  rooms are small you may see a rap star or two but that s about it in terms of excitement far from sunset bars westwood is ok for a night but gets old so if you don t have a car don t stay at the w if you are visiting kids at ucla and don t mind overpaying then the w is the nicest walking distance hotel but the hilgard house across the street probably will give you everything you need for a third of the price

w  stands for what the            we are a family of 4 and stayed at the w los angeles in a two bedroom suite the furniture must have come from an ikea sale what little furniture there was was either torn or did not work it is desperate for a renovation the wall are made of paper not great if you don t like to hear the next door apartment at 500am turning on their tv there is no soundproofing from the street and you can hear any car passing by the service at the poolside restarvice was pathetic to say the least ontop of this every single chair around the pool was booked for a private event so screw the paying guests we were booked in for 4 nights but barely made it through one even after they gave us the night free we still felt ripped off
never again   showreview 1499416  full
greedy   showreview 1344702  full
look elsewhere for good service showreview 1273307  full
the place stinks  find another hotel  showreview 499395  full

handy for universal studios but that s all we stayed 3 nights at the beverly garlands holiday inn it was easy to find as just off the freeway it s really close to universal studios and they do lay on a shuttle bus to take you there if you catch the time right that is as we found it sat on the car park most the time and it was quicker to walk as this bus also drops at the metro station  or so we were told we never actually caught it  our room was of the bogstandard variety and did us for the 3 nights its a shame it s so far out of the way we had to catch the metro and buses everyday to do any sight seeing but on the bright side the metro is very cheap and if your doing alot of travelling it s worth getting a day ticket we did have breakfast one morning at the bg and the pancakes  maple syrup were great watch out for the guy standing outside the hotel who wants to sell you tours he caught us the second we walked out of the hotel and before we knew it we where on a 4 hour tour of la and 120 lighter rob who was our tour guide was great and there was only 2 other people on the trip so that was a bonus there are lots of tour companies doing the same routes whether the cheaper ones are as good i just couldn t say
nicest holiday inn i ve stayed at my husband and i were pleased about our choice to stay at this hotel it was clean the room was spacious and comfortable and the staff was helpful and friendly
los angeles great  plenty to see       trip to see los angeles

good value hotel  my husband and i stayed here for 3 nights in nov 08 and we found this hotel fairly average it was clean and quiet with all the relevant amenities one would expect for a 3 star hotel the hotel had a minibus to take their guests to universal studios every hour  which was v convenient and it only took only 5mins and the concierge was v helpful with giving directions and organising tours to downtown la the chinese theatre beverly hills etc foodwise the onsite restaurant is ok but a little bit pricey for decent food head to citywalk at the side of universal studios  although it s still pricey   this hotel is not close to anything else except for universal studios  warner bros studios if you want to be downtown and nearer to the other attractions  don t stay here

average rooms the welcoming of our stay was very friendly the ladys at the frontdesk are doing a great job top  the free shuttlebus is nice also the parking place of the hotel is good we had a good time in this hotel we did not had breakfast the restaurant looked very nicethe rooms are average perhaps i expected a much newer look reading the hotel reviews before bookingi liked it but next time a try another hotel

lived up to expectations  we  family of four stayed in this property for two nights at the end of october 08 the hotel is exactly what you would expect from an above average holiday inn the staff were friendly and efficient the location is good and the shuttle to universal is great the problem with the drivers consierge trying to sell additional trips is exaggerated in my opinion we just politely said no thanks and there was no problem the restaurant attached didn t look great so we eat locally for breakfast the neighbourhood cafe as recommended by ta reviewers and it was great  for dinner we drove to santa monica  about 15 20 mins and there were lots of varied restaurants to choose from all in all a very satisfactory stay

great location  as a first time visitor to la we weren t too sure which area to stay in and had heard some horror stories about staying in hollywood the beverly garland was recommended by a friend although the travel agent said they didnt recommend it without a car  which we did not have  the hotel was great good location couple of bars shops within a 10 minute walk and the shuttle bus to universal was excellent the metro was only a 15 minute walk and this took us into hollywood  i would definately stay here again any questions please email me

great hotel for seeing all the hollywood  la sights we booked this hotel last minute as we wanted a pretty central hotel to see the sights of la and hollywood check in was quick and simple room was comfortable and clean had everything we needed the hotel had a smallish pool and people seemed to use it throughout the day  what a waste of potential la sight seeing time though    there was a decent cafe  restaurant type place which was good for breakfast the hotel provided a free shuttle bus to universal studios which was handy too the location was great for us as we had a car but then i don t think anyone goes to la without their own transport do they we found this hotel very convenient and much more reasonable than staying in other hotels in similar locations
relaxing old school hotel       view of our room from the coutyard

great stay at this fine hotel we had a great stay at beverly garland s holliday inn we are a 5 person family from norway and had to have 2 rooms we got connecting rooms which we were very happy with we were all together and we had lots of space at the same time we enjoyed the comfort of two bathrooms 2 tv s as which was fine since the oldest and the younger children had different interests we were very happy with the rooms the service of the staff the possibility to bath in the pool and the possibility to wash our clothes in the valet laundry we also have to mension the fabulous service we got from sonia at the tula s cafe the breakfast was always our daughter karianne was became very fond of her all in all we don t have anything negtive to say about our stay the only thing that keeps us from top score is that we never got any resonse to the emails we sent to the hotel with a few questions before we arrived if we get a chance we will be back all our regards to the hotel and to so sonia in the cafe

close to universal studios good clean hotel very close to universal studios  5 min in car and close to freeway and hollywoodsmall pool but good to cool off inrestaurant good but not great overall good place to stay if you want to stay in this area of la

great place great price we stayed at the beverly garland hotel last july we wanted a place that was near the universal studios park we stayed for a couple of nights and we were pleasently surprised the ambiance was very california with nice touches the place well mantained pool gardens tennis court etc the room was clean and spacious and the restaurant on site was really good   we had a great dinner for less money than for the greasy pizza we had at the theme park  we would stay here again with out a doubt and they even have a free shuttle to the park very convenient

wonderful in its simplicity excellent frontdesk arrived on july 11th and spent two nights the man at the frontdesk was very helpful and interested in our travel plans we asked for a ground floor room and he offered us one with the least traffic noise although the hotel was fully booked every question we had about los angeles how to get here and there was answered calmly and professionally  the recepion has a drawer with little pieces op paper with the faq of their guests impressive bever seen anything like it the room was ok not too big not small either a little balcony overlooking the parking so little dragging with the suitcases the shuttle for universal studios was very ok regular timings so no need to take a hotel close to universal which are in the middle of nowhere except of course the theme park itself for future visitors who don t want to spend a lot of money on breakfast leave the hotel and turn left just before the traffic lights turn left again and you will see a large ralphs supermarket

pleasantly surprised i booked this hotel for a one night stay using my priority club points this was just a very quick in and out visit from our main las vegas vacation specifically to see stevie wonder at the hollywood bowl  fantastic by the way upon check in the desk clerk upgraded us to a suite as i have a platinum priority club card for a start this doesnt appear to be usual procedure for holiday inn despite what their website says so i was happy with that the room was on the 7th floor and was two rooms knocked into one so was spacious one side contained the bed and bathroom and the other side had a living area and another bathroom  so they could convert back into 2 rooms easily i guess  the  rooms were separated by a wooden lattice panel giving the room a kind of eastern feeling the decor was nice neutral tones and exposed painted brickwork and we had a large plasma screen hanging from the wall on a swivel pole so we could turn it round and watch from either the bedroom or living space the bed was super comfy  to be honest we didnt spend enough time at the hotel to check out any of the dining facilities or pool so i cant comment on them but the room was great the desk clerk was really welcoming and also gave us a bag of free stuff water chocolate etcwe spent our free afternoon at universal city walk and theres a shuttle bus from the hotel that picks up and drops off every hour or so so convenient we ve talked about holidaying in the hollywood area again so would definitely look at staying here again

not as bad as everyone thinks i stayed at the beverly garland holiday inn starting on july 13th16th 2008 i took the time and read the reviews regarding the hotel and took everything in some people stated on the reviews that the food was horrible and that the area wasn t safe here is an honest review that i hope helps everyone from a frequent hotel traveler the hotel is outdated and is in need of a few face lifts including new carpeting in the hallways the hallways could also use a bit more lighting but it isn t scary the room was clean and came with a coffee maker hairdryer tons of towels  we had 4 adults in our room and an iroining board etc our room was kept clean and we never had a problem we stayed in the eldorado building which if sitting outside on the small balcony  large enough for two people to sit the sound of the freeway is noticeable but once you are inside the room with the airconditioning on you can t even hear it our group didn t have any problem sleeping when we arrived we were asked about taking tours and we simply said that we were there for business so we didn t have timewe weren t asked again and i never felt pressured or pushed to attend a tour we took advantage of the coffee shop and i experienced an okay chai latte but not a big deal we had the breakfast buffet in the morning which costs 11 95 i personally felt that this was a bit steep considering what was offered and felt that if it was around 7 95 that would be betterbut the food was good the eggs were egg beaters but it wasn t terrible the area surrounding the hotel is safe we attended an event about three blocks up and was able to walk back to the hotel at 1100pm without an issue the only issue that i had was that we had to pay for parking now i was only charged 11 00 a day vs the 13 00 i am hearing but i still think that this is ridiculous since i was staying at their hotel and already giving them money via the hotel room this wouldn t make me not stay there again but i would look for a place that maybe didn t charge as much the location is not far from universal studios and there is a shuttle that is offered by the hotel to get you there the shuttle does not pick up at the airportplease keep that in mind when making plans i hope this helps

good location we enjoyed out stay at the beverly garland locationthe location of the beverly garland is goodust off the freeway with easy access to disney  took us about an hour but the traffic is crazy  there are a number of hollywood la tours you can book right at the hotel the bus stops at the hotel to pick you up and you really don have to travel far the shuttle to universal is great but when youe returning home at night remember that a ton of other guests will be returning as well and there may not be room for you  which means you wait for the next shuttle  fyi spend the extra  and take the vip tour at universal great value for money and if you don book it you will probably spend your day hating those  and yourself with the vip cards who go right past you in line and who get to get off their trams and explore the sets while you sit on your tram and simply drive by while at the beverly we spent a day at universal a day touring hollywood and a day at santa monica beach  not a bad drive at all considering it is la  rooms no fridge but otherwise fine nice simple accommodation you probably don want a room on the ground floor since these rooms are actually ownstairsand really only have a view of the hill theye built into we started out on the second floor and had sewage back up in the tub  gross but they moved us immediately no problem and ended up on the first floor right near the pool very convenient there is laundry in one of the buildings pool small but nice always loads of loungers snack bar and towels there a hot tub and sauna too but we didn use these food i liked tula the menu had loads of variety and the prices were reasonable concerns my concerns are not so much about the hotel but have more to do with the fact that i booked this hotel because of its review in frommer frommer stated that kids under 12 eat free that didn happen for us and i not sure why was just told that we didn have that package maybe frommer should indicate you have to buy a special package to get this also frommer indicated free parking that also did not happene paid 13 a day i believe minor things i know but these were two reasons i booked here so i was annoyed this is a very pleasant family hotel and a good location from which to sightsee there really not much around the hotel itself  very residential but i would recommend it as a base from which to do universal and see la

disappointed by the beg bug we chose this hotel because it was close to universal studios it was the cheapest in the area and it provided free shuttle service to universal studios the staff was nice and friendly no problem with the sevice at all the food was good little pricey but okay the rooms appeared to be clean the first morning i got up went to my aunt s room  she and her granddaughter were still in bed i noticed a red stain on the sheet of the bed the 9 year old was sleeping in i approached the bed and then observed little bugs i smashed the bug with a piece of paper and it stained the sheet looked like a blood stain would you know it bed bugs we called immediately to the front desk we were told the manager was not on site they sent up the engineer he checked behind the headboard with a flashlight an hour later someone else came to the room and he tried to tell us that these bugs came in sliding door because it was open and that they were not bed bugs not knowing that we had caught them in a plastic bag and showed him the evidence that these were in fact bed bugs he finally agreed to not charge us for that night moved them to another room after that our stay was good
mixed emotions       beverly garland s holiday inn

great value for money and one stop from hollywood myself and three of my friends stayed at this hotel as part of a miniature californian tour it was clean the staff were friendly and i did not notice any noise from the motorway the reason i chose this hotel was its relatively close proximity to hollywood there is a five minute walk to the subway rail station and then one stop and you walk out right at the chinese theatre this was perfect for us as we went out clubbing at the tropicana and the roosevelt hotel overall this hotel provides clean accomodation and serves perfectly as a base for those who wish to go out drinking in hollywood

nice clean quiet for a relasing break this hotel i picked was based on reviews i had read from this website i was pleasnalty suprised at how quiet the hotel was and when i did arrive i was dealt with promptly the hotel reception was nice and helpful but the concierge baggage handlers were a bit unhelpful and alwas trying to sell us tours when a tour came to pickup a few people from the hotel i overheard the concierge asking for his cut  not nice to see or hear and on the final day when we were going to the airport because we booked out own transfer they didnt tell me when they arrived and didnt open the doors or help with our luggage or anything like that good point was its location to universal studios and the free shuttle that it took us to daily if we wanted it

what a noise very noisey hotel at side of freeway asked to be moved no response from the management found them rude toilet in room didnt work right had it fixed 3 times very isolated position dont stop here

this place can write the book on service we stayed here for a total of 7 days at the start  end of a southern california  nevada holiday the check in was fast  efficient the room was huge  though located at the back overlooking the hollywood freeway was very quiet thanks to the double glazing wifi access in our room was excellent free shuttle bus service to the nearby metro station  universal studios is great as was the discounted tickets for universal studios in the gift shop i can t say enough good things about this hotel we booked through a company called purely america  found the price very reasonable big thanks to richie  all the front desk staff for helping us enjoy a fantastic holiday

a very great experience  we are two young italian sisters and we went to united states alone for the first time on feb 2007 to see the oscar event in real life we decided to stay at beverly garland holiday inn and we had a very nice time there it is not so close to hollywood and you can t reach by walk the most important attraction of the town but with a short walk you can reach the subway that easily take you wherever you want in la and surrounding area  the walk fromto the subway takes about 15 minutes the staff is friendly and help you to do whatever in you for example we had a problem to phone in italy when we arrived and they helped us to show how to do it   they booked all the excurions for us and suggested which places to see the rooms are big with big beds for europen people they were clean and nice to enter in the rooms block you don t need to pass in front of the reception if you don t want they have a separate access and you can enter only with your keycard they have a swimming pool they also have a restaurant very close to it you can reach it in a very short walk they offer breakfast and dinner  the only thing is that the menu was always the same but that s it   beside this restaurant there are not very close places to eat or to shop anyway they also have free shuttle to and from the universal studios anyway we suggest this hotel to people with a car because is very close to the freeway but we had no problems even if we did not have a car so if you don t mind walking from and to the subway it is a nice hotel and then you are in la close to the hotel there are typical houses there is starbucks  not too close and los angeles is simply amazing
heres the facts from our trip   2 queen beds room

ideal for exploring hollywood ideal for exploring hollywood near to the metro and buses for getting to the main tourist attractions yet located in aquiet part of hollywood so that you can relax after a day out rooms are very clean and comfortable and have tea service tv etc nice restaurant coffe shop and bar although becomes crowded at breakfast nice pool with plenty of shade

just okay this hotel is conveniently located to universal which is why we chose it we actually walked from the park one day back to the hotel they do provide a free shuttle though the hotel is very dated is needing updating badly it was only soso in the cleanliness area it wasn t great and it wasn t terrible very overpriced though

good location nice facilities we visited california to see my son who is attending school near hollywood the location was great very conveneint access to most areas the room itself was nice and clean tula s was average food i thought the buffet breakfast was a bit high for what you got we only ate there once the maids are a little late in the day cleaning they rarely got there until 3 or 4 the elevators were a little slow and parking is 11 00 a day the grounds are lovely and they have a free airport shuttle i would stay again

nice hotel with good location i was nervous about staying at this hotel as i had read reviews after finding out where my hotel had been booked  won a trip to see the police in concert so all choices were made for me  the hotel is a bit older but it s a good average hotel the onsite restaurant had wonderful food even though it was fairly quiet there the onsite bar was also fun  we d been drinking and didn t know where to catch a cab to go to so just stayed there  the employees at both the restaurant and club were very friendly and helpful if i had o go to that area again i would definitely keep this hotel in mind my only complaint paying for parking which isn t noted on the website anywhere

great stay and friendly responsive staff we stayed at the beverly garland for five nights in aug 2007 even though they had made a mistake by giving our room to someone else which we discovered on arrival and check in they immediately took care of it gave us free parking and were very apologetic the hotel is lovely clean and quiet with a great restaurant attached in fact the best food for the money we had in la the pool is very nice large well maintained and clean i felt safe and away from the la madness while we were there the rooms are adequate and typical holiday inn fare but clean and functional it is close to the 101 which takes you everywhere you want to go and five minutes from universal studios they have a free shuttle to universal which runs throughout the day so glad we found this hotel

good hotel we spent three nights there and had a nice time the hotel has a good vibe and this is complimented by the extremely friendly service the rooms are not huge but they are clean cosy and comfortable also the location is very convenient you can reach universal or the walk of fame easily by car the only negative was the size of the pool way too small

good price performance comfortable clean hotel with friendly employees good restaurant for your breakfast and dinner double rooms rather small but good for short stays five minutes by car to universal studios      some rooms are rather noisy because it s located near the 110

very nice convenient clean we had a wonderful stay at this holiday inn very clean  spacious rooms helpful staff it is very near to universal studios  not walking distance but near enough and other hollywood attractions pool was small but clean restaurant was great nothing fancy just clean safe accomodations for you  your family and friends

not so good we checked in for a weekend at 176 00 per night plus 11 to park each night we had cockroaches in our room and the carpet was so dankand nasty that you wouldn t dare walk on it bare foot  not that you would in any hotel  the burger from room service was good monday the rate fell to 149 00 a night the kicker for me was as we were leaving they wouldn t let me use their luggage cart  without a bell hop who was busy  as we were driving out of the gated parking lot  not for security but to control  my card wouldn t work and the arm would not raise we went to the best western carriage inn in sherman oaks 114 00 a night and 5 times cleaner rooms came with a fridge and the employees were great even if you are going to universal everyday i would stay at the best western and drive

good place for a night or two in hollywood stayed here for a night in april 2007 prior to flying back to the uk chose it mainly for proximity to universal this hotel is absolutely fine for a night or 2 it is dated and in need of some money spending on it but it is clean and tidy good level of in room amenities and security is good on site coffeee shop and small store the hotel runs a free shuttle to universal and there are set times to and back but we found that you could ask for a special trip or additional trip and the guys were happy to oblige  fantastic service  a cab is 6 each way  as we only stayed for a night did not venture out and about drive to lax is 60 minutes at 4pm and is easy  the holiday inn website will let you find and print directions  car park at hotel 11 a day overall it s not the best hotel i haver ever stayed in but it serves a purpose and i would stay again

a pleasant surprise i wasn t quite sure what to expect at the beverly garland but it was definitely better than i thought it would be after reading some of the reviews posted here the overall impression that greeted me on arriving was that it was quite dated the reception staff were very helpful and the staff in the gift tour shop were extremely friendly and helpful the room on first impressions was pretty cramped but adequate clean and comfortable we were put in the annex building which overlooked the freeway the noise wasn t a problem unless you left the balcony door open the complimentry wifi connection for my laptop was excellent we had a toilet blockage but the maintenance man was there within 10 minutes to fix it  this was at 10 pm  the restaurant at the front  tula s served some excellent food and had an outdoor area where you could eat  drink when the weather was nice  which we did you could also order room service from here you would definitely need a car if you wanted to go shopping as the nearest mall was about 10 mins away by car and the hotel is a bit isolated unless you are planning to go to universal  the hotel runs a regular free shuttle throughout the day  we were only here for two nights as a stopover travelling from australia new zealand and fiji and we did a tour to tijuana on one day  which is another story  so did not feel the need to hire a car overall it was ok

noisy not the place to stay if you want to sleep the rooms were well kept they are actually what a holiday inn should look like unfortunately the ajoining door between rooms was the source of major niose the next door neighbors were watching tv all night i wouldn t have made much of it but with thin walls and with an ajoining door we could hear everything the tv was on all last night there i even tried to put a towel under the door it didn t work i was up until 5am the housekeeping service also knocks on the door at 930am when you get less than 5 hours of sleep housekeeping are the last people you want to see also my key cards did not work the second night when i went to the desk they were  fixed but when i tried again only one worked the staff was not overly friendly i had to ask for my rewards perks even though it should say so in the computer the plus of the stay was the lady in the gift shop she knew all about the tours and which would best suite us she even wanted to save us money be prepaired to pay for parking with aaa9 without 11
very nice hotel       the hotel  at night

wonderful just wonderful i read reviews about this hotel just before leaving the uk and was overall impressed and then read one about the maid service being every 3 days and head lice  what a load of rubbish that is we stayed here for 2 weeks and the hotel room and grounds are spotless the maids come in every single day with fresh clean towels and linen they also hoover up and top up your free coffee etc etc if you have made any brews unlike some of my experiences in spain the maids also will not come into your room if u have put the  do no disturb sign outside your door i had an off day during our holiday and was glad to see they adhere to your requests and dont still insist on coming in also someone said there is not much around the hotel area erm universal studios and city walk is only 7 min walk away to the tram that takes u up the hill the red line metro station is also on route to universal just go left out the hotel left onto ventura and left again across the freeway flyover u will also pass a shopping complex on vineland just before ventura blvd which has everthing u need including a kodak shop incase u run out of camera batteries etc the onsite gift shop prices are very respectable and the lady who works there during the day is superb at helping u if u want to book tours or airport pick ups if u dont fancy the short walk to the metro and universal the 156 metro bus goes to hollywood highland which u can get from across the street from the hotel carpark entrance resturant breakfast is excellent with the only downside being that the buffet unlike other hotels is not free and u have to pay 11 95 per person for it before tipping etc also they have 2 internet computers in the splash lounge which u just put 1 or 5 dollar bills in to gain your desired time u need for surfing

hated the head lice i stayed at this hotel based on its proximity to universal studios and it was cheaper than the sheraton or hilton i was disappointed with the facilities the hotel definitely needs a refurbishment but it did appeared to be clean unfortunate i got head lice from stay notices in the room state that the linen is changed every 3 days unless you request it daily i guess the cleaning staff must be enforcing this rule even if new guests are using the room definitely spoilt what should have been an enjoyable trip to the usa

clean comfortable but getting a little pricey   i ve stayed here numerous times over the last four years in the beginning it was a bit shabby  torn wallpaper mold poor ventilation etc  but you put up with it because it was only 100 to 110 per night now since a change in ownership it s 140  150 per night and parking is up to 11 night the rooms are still a bit dated and uncomfortable the restaurant has improved greatly  though it s menu is limited the bar however is still a disaster bad modern decor it s not friendly or comfortable at all the restaurant staff and the cleaning staff are very friendly the gift shop staff is not the front desk staff run hot and cold it s a convenient place to stay if you don t mind the traffic noise from the hollywood freeway if only they d remodel and refurnish the rooms

dated and nothing nearby          i read a lot of reviews on this hotel and instead of taking heed of what others had said i went ahead anyway we wanted a hotel close enough to the universal studios and not knowing the area opted for this holiday inn thinking the standard must me pretty much the same as others in this chain but found the rooms to be rather dated and a bit musty smelling we arrived on christmas evening were told the restaurant would be serving and providing room service until 8pm when we tried the number it went onto voice mail i left and order which never arrived so my family went to bed hungry as there is nothing within easy walking distance of the hotel however the same restaurant had a lovely breakfast buffet although the children were charged for the buffet but ate free from the breakfast menu a plus factor is that this hotel provides a shuttle to universal studios and is on the pick up route for star line tours and other tours companies so a car is not essential if you opt to stay here we cut our stay short and went to santa monica holiday inn i could kick myself for not basing ourselves there from the outset and doing day trips to universal and for the la tour that we took the staff were pleasant and efficient the shuttle driver prompt and friendly and the restaurant staff good too if you are going to universal there are plenty of hotels much closer with more going on around them and they look less dated than this aged hotel

comfortable beds really nice breakfast booked 2 rooms through priceline com for a friday night 100 we stayed just to sleep for the night the king size bed was very comfortable the rooms and property overall are well maintained older look but well maintained two exits from universal studios city walk we didnt use the pool but it looked very small for the size of the property the best part of our stay was breakfast the food was piping hot and especially loved that it was not greasy we had eggs home potatoes bacon toast french toast fresh fruit freshly squeezed orange juice pancakes and omellettes good breakfast spot they even served seattles best coffee if you asked for it otherwise you got folgers i would definitely stay here again for a short visit i may even drive by and have breakfast if im in the area
nice place for universal studios good place to stay if you re planning on seeing universal studios a good value hotel breakfast and hotel bar are both good also has a decent pool
brilliant hotel hotel brilliant all facilities u could need only criticism is shuttle bus provided by hotel finishes too early at night but thetre are buses and taxis on the road outside

very mellow comfortable hotel but a bit pricy this hotel has a shuttle to universal studiosfree it stops at about 9 pm though it is a great big hotel it is quiet for the most part it has a great pool outside the staff is very helpful and the rooms beds and pillows are very comfortable they have no fridge or microwave in the rooms though it is pricy but worth it if your budget allows for it the restaurant has very good breakfast

ventalation problems the landscaping was nice the people were nice and the rates were totally reasonable the restaurant and bar also had very reasonable rates however the building with rooms has serious mold and ventalation problems i could barely breathe in the hallways and could only manage to survive in the room with a towel on the door crack and the sliding glass door wide open the last night someone was smoking on a nearby balcony and that woke me up at 2am  they were quietit was just the smell  the first two nights i woke a few times from noise i asked for a room on the side not facing the freeway but the other road was super loud too both these problems wouldn t have occurred if i had simply closed my windowbut seriously they have a problem with the air you could see peeling paint and wallpaper in the bathrooms and in the vending room on each floor it was obvious i m not sure what the solution isagain the layout of the grounds is very nice so it d be a shame to raise the building but if it was my house i would

the place to be in north hollywood just got back from a five night stay at the bg holiday inn and thought it was comparable to a marriott this facility is selfcontained pool restaurant coffee shop and bar all on the wellmanicured premises great central location for touring hollywood reasonable rates and friendly staff only downside was the in the blond wig holding a mop who knocked on the door at 2 a m one night claiming to be the beverly garland and asking if we needed house cleaning service maybe this was just part of the hollywood experience

scary room i stayed at this motel after reading positive reviews on this site overall the room was ok but it was scary because of the lock it looked like someone had tried to break in as there was a deep break in the door where the security latch was in addition the door was loose and would move if you pushed against it even with the double locks in place when i mentioned my concerns i was offered an engineer but because i felt that nothing short of a door replacement would help i decided to wait it out as we were only there for another day i liked the double sinks at the bathroom  this helped tremendously when we were getting dressed to go out the dark hallways and block walls added to the scariness of this hotel not sure that i felt 100 percent safe and would probably not stay here again maid service was also inconsistent and minimal by the way i m not a paranoid type person so it was unusual for me to be scared at this motel

girl from giftshop people from reception every day vry unfriendly  hi everybody i just came back from a holiday trip to los angeles i was on my own i went in total to three different hotels my first hotel was awesome people from the reception were incredibly friendly wanted to help me with everything my second hotel was beverly garland terrible even the manager i have never seen somebody doing so unfriendly to their guests the girl from the giftshop what was she thinking she showed me that she didnt wanted to help me she did this also to other guests and if she arranged something she did everything wrong few examples she arranged a tour for me what wasnt available that day i said that to her    but she said it was confirmed and this was a exception she refused to call the touroperator for me again i went to that touroperator by myself starline tours and i was right  they said that the tour wasnt even available i already paid for it and it was all a waste of time  i lost three very important irreplaceable things in my taxi i asked them to help me and i have waited literal 3 hours in the gift shop she needed three hours to make a phone call to the taxi and believe it or not after all that wasting of time i wanted to see la not the gift shop she called the wrong taxi while i said so many times to her which one it was the reception promised me to call the right one the day i was leaving they still havent done it i have explained my story literal 8 times they were not interested at all  my shower was broken they promised to send someone 5 hours later still nobody have went to my room location is quit isolated some people who have been there are describing it as very quiet well i am describing it as isolated the aircondition is making a lot of noise a nice thing is that every room has a little balcony and also a nice thing is that there is a restaurant next to the hotel with friendly people i will not go to this hotel again the one most important thing i noticed in los angeles was that everybody was so kind everyone is willing to help everybody is greeting other people so i was very surprised that the staff of this hotel was so rude my other two hotels were awesome with very very kind people so this is probably an exception

comfortable but extremely noisy            i have good news and bad news   first   the good news   the staff at the beverly garland is very friendly and courteous the pool temperature was very comfortable with plenty of towels and lounge chairs the shuttle to universal studios was timely and convenient the beds and pillows were comfortable and the room was clean i especially loved the overstuffed easy chair  extremely comfortable now   the bad news  this was our 2nd stay at the beverly garland holiday inn we must have stay in a different area last time because i don t remember the freeway noise being so loud i kept checking the sliding door  thinking one of the kids might have opened it but no it is just so loud from the constant noise of freeway traffic my husband went to the front desk around 1130pm to request a quieter room the person he spoke to said no 2bed guestrooms were available and said we were in one of the quieter room needless to say we didn t sleep well the rooms are not cheap we paid  csaa rate 144 00  plus sc per night and 9 00 for parking we reserved a 2night stay however we actually checked out of the hotel before the 2nd night  we only stayed one night instead of two  the women who finalized our bill was very nice and she understood us wanting to check out early and allowed us to do so without a penalty for cancelling our reservation i just wanted to go home and get a  good night sleep  i figured driving 6hours home was better than going 8hours with that noise   overall the beverly garland is a decent place the kids loved the pool and the staff is very nice i highly recommend asking for a room far away from the freeway would i stay there again only if i can be guaranteed a room facing furthest away from the freeway

two nights of noise we spent two nights here while visiting hollywood and warner bros studios at first glance the hotel looks o k   my husband and i both thought it reminded us of the sort of place we stayed in as kids during summer road trips with our families  i e very 1970 s kitsch once inside the rooms are just o k once you hop into bed after a long day of sight seeing   look out it really sounds as if you are sleeping next to the daytona speedway the beds are super shaky  i e if one person moves the entire bed sort of tilts we thought we could mask the freeway noise by keeping the wall unit a c on all night but it s set to a thermostat it starts with a loud bang and stops with a thunk   all night long it s better to just try and deal with the nonstop traffic noise if you bring your own pillows from home make sure that they don t have white pillow cases our pillow cases and one of our pillows vanished the first time housekeeping came to change our linens and haven t been seen since we were promised that they would be mailed to us when they are found on a positive the hotel restaurant was superb the staff was very polite throughout our entire stay that said i don t think we ll be returning anytime soon for an extra 30 00 a night we should have stayed at the sheraton

kidsuite was great on a road trip to hollywood with my 14  12 year old kids  1 boy 1 girl we stayed at the beverly garland holiday inn the staff was very friendly  even returning my phone after i left it at the restaurant and wasn t able to come get it myself until the next morning  the kidsuite was great though their selection of games  dvds is extremely limited  glad we brought our own  it was great to have an empty fridge instead of a minibar fridge only hitch was not fitting on the universal studios shuttle the first day i wasn t told seating was limited so didn t hurry to get in the front of the line we didn t fit and i was told no standing and i d have to wait for the next shuttle but we needed to be at the park for our vip tour time so we had to pay for a cab then on the trip home the same shuttle driver let 2 guests on without seats  standing
fantastic

nice hotel safe location we stayed at the beverly garland holiday inn on sunday march 26 2006 there was four of us and the price with the advance purchase came to 136 00 per night   155 14 with taxes 8 00 per day to parkservice was very quick and staff was friendly the snack gift shop has maps shirts snacks and you can book tours from there   example   tour of the stars homes the shuttle will come and pick you up from the hotel hotel also has a restaurant later at night my daughter was hungry but we didn t feel like going into the restaurant to eat or pay high prices for room service so we decided to place an order and pick it up ourselves at the restaurant we placed an order with the restaurant and they said you can come get it that it is ready now and by the time we walked down there it was ready that was nice and saved us money nice clean hotel and the location is safe  some areas in hollywood are scary  it is close to universal and about 5 miles from the hollywood walk of fame and about 78 miles from farmer s market and the la brea tarpits negatives would be   the price of the hotel  but consider the area and the hotel could improve update the hallways i was in california for about a week and stayed at other hotels if you would like to look at those reviews area hotelslos angeles  near lax  marriott renaissance montura anaheim  near disneyland  holiday inn expresshuntington beach  best western huntington beach innlong beach  the coast long beach hotel

don t need to do it again okay but some problems probably explains it best the beds weren t the worst we ve slept in but they definately weren t the best if you don t mind a little  rolling into the center  the problem   noise the traffic noise was so bad in the first room they tried to give us i thought something was running in the room the second room which was less noisey sounded as though someone was nonstop vacuuming in the next room it is definately not a hotel for you if you are looking for quiet the landscaping i bet is gorgeous in the summer

conveniently located to universal studio we spent four nights at beverly garland holiday inn from 1115 to 1119 2005 we loved the location and holiday inn shuttle bus can take you to and from universal studio and metro station no need to rent a car for staying this hotel we took metro bus and train to and from la international airport lax  around two hours only if you are not in a hurry metro train can take you to hollywood walk of fame and downtown la or even long beach holiday inn cleanliness is about average elavator inside pushbuttons are really dirty no one seems to care i was advised by previos tripavisors that requesting to stay at eldorado building without freeway noise we simly heeded the advice overall you can not beat the location without paying a lot more than this holiday inn

needs hollywood facelift the hotel needs to have a facelift hollywood style  the rooms and corridors need to be modernised feel very stale they are very clean which makes it all look better the bar and restaurant are excellent food very good and service in the restaurant brilliant the reception staff have a weary look from perhaps dealing with lots of people being tourists in hollywood   one was very helpful full marks for customer care to her the hotel is surrounded by busy roads which are incredibly noisy the glazing does not deal with this at all which proves the hotel would benefit from a modernisation programme

ok if you can stand the traffic noise the hotel room was fine given the price we paid the bathroom was small and very basic the biggest problem is the traffic noise we had expected that the noise would die down by about 11 pm  but it didn t let up all night if you have a room that doesn t overlook the interstate then i would imagine that you would have a fairly pleasant stay the location is good for universal  2 minutes on the free hotel bus

3 days in hollywood right on the doorstep of universal studios  one of our primary reasons for going  the beverly garland holiday inn was ideally placed as we found out venues and attractions are spread over a wide space in l a it s a big place public transport is not good and taxi s are expensive if you have a lot of travelling to do so hire a car and fight with the traffic the holiday inn was a warm and friendly hotel with very comfortable rooms and had the look and feel of a latterday  high chaperal  for those of you old enough to remember the show it has a small outdoor pool and the restaurant served good food and a wide breakfast selection if we were in that neck of the woods again we d stay there

we liked this hotel we stayed recently  apr 69 and i was so freaked out about arriving to this hotel and finding some awful place but was so relieved to turn the corner and find a nice shady highrise hotel with several buildings  several hotel building pods i guess you might say  we went after most spring breaks were over no crowd in the lobby or at desk we were checked in promptly and our request for a quiet room away from any freeway noise was given no problem we stayed in the portola building 6th floor elevator was easily accessible on both ends of the building the room was large nicely decorated  yes not modern but cozy  the balcony was nice to have with chairs and a table no screens but that wasn t a problem the room was very clean inside and out three pillows to each bed nice easy chair lamp and sidetable by the balcony for sitting and reading nice desk  wonderful lighting clean bathroom small coffee bar area  unfortunately no minifridge  outdoor sink and mirror as well as inside the bathroom so you don t have to wait to do hair makeup nice pool area  heated pool  i was excited to see what i thought was a jacuzzi hot tub but it was a small wading pool they need a hot tub   the shuttle is busy but if it is full he takes them and comes right back for you you don t have to wait another hour frankly we walked home one night it isn t that far if you like to walk this is also just in walking distance to a very nice market complex  ralphs with jamba juice starbucks places to eat etc i think the folks who wrote not nice things are clean freaks people who expected a four star hotel  the hilton is up the hill  this place is just fine everyone was nice i would encourage the hotel to put in minifridges and turn that wading pool into a jacuzzi

disappointing this was the first of three hotels used on our trip to california and was by far the poorest the rooms were ok but the noise from the freeway was constant and the windows had double glazing which had the noise reducing qualities of tissue paper i would strongly advise the management to replace these as they are useless the lift nearest our room went out of service which meant a trek to the opposite end of the wing i was not impressed and would not recommend to others

definitely not the greatest this place appears great on the surface but if you re a clean freak or just even picky you might not be happy after thinking that our room seemed ok  definitely decorated in the late 70 s  i discovered that the shower had cracks in the tiles and was peeling and it was very difficult to turn the water on for myself and my children also after trying to kill one of the bugs flying around in the room i ended up swatting the lampshade and a huge pile of dust flew off after that experience we looked a little bit harder at the room and even found a gigantic spiderweb up on the ceiling near the curtains totally gross room service pizza was disgusting  about an inch of grease sitting atop the pepperoni  we had to take tons of kleenex and sop it all up before we could even try it and that still didn t help then the 9 pizza turned into over 16 somehow on the final bill the day we wanted to go to universal we got there 15 minutes earlier than they said the first shuttle would run over there and there was already a shuttle full of people on and leaving we were not allowed on and were told to wait the 9 they charge per night for parking is actually 10 after they add the tax plus some entertainment tax of one kind or another my kids liked it  of course  they re kids and not paying  but believe me    you can do better

good convenient location    my husband and i stayed at this hotel 3 183 22 05 the hotel was clean enough   pretty mobbed in the lobby and we had to wait quite a while to check in after a long flight the room was clean enough and soso as far as accomodations the telephones and internet connection in our room didn t work we had to call down to the front desk 4 separate times before we finally got the phones to work the internet never did function correctly the hallways and carpets were pretty worn out and seedy the gift shop was supposed to be open all day and into the night but we tried to use it about 8 different times and found a closed sign listing what time the clerk would be back pretty aggravating they advertised a heated pool whirlpool and sauna the pool was chilly and full of leaves the whirlpool was cool too and the sauna was unusablepiled full of outdoor furniture the good things i can say about this place the location was great for our visitclose to universal studiosclose driving distance to hollywood downtown la and a nice drive to santa monica and malibu plus the place was pretty laid back and relaxed at least it was not as nice as i d hoped but i did enjoy the stay because of the great location

great stay location for universal a very nice option for anyone going to universal city walk amphitheatre studios enjoyed the room the newness apparent in the appointments from shower curtain to carpets to three pillows on the bed  the balcony access with its fresh air room service took a tad long but food was satisfactory pleasant aesthetic style in room design complimentary shuttle option to universal tho we didn t know it was on a set schedule  once an hour so it ended up not being convenient for us to make use of this time very easy access off the 101

hotel was nice nice comfortable rooms where we spent 6 nights nice landscaped gardens but a little noisy from the motorway near by however rooms were reasonably sound proofed so had no problems with sleeping plenty of parking but found 9 a day charge somewhat steep would recommend asking for a room overlooking ventura blvd as i m sure this would be quieter  something i did not do  would stay there again

very pleasant we moved from a different hotel and were very pleasantly surprised at how well we were treated at this hotel the staff was accommodating and the room was very nice at a very reasonable price the restaurant that was attached to it had a great breakfast and very nice people working there all in all my wife and i were very please we certainly would stay there again

rename it to hoover hotel  iot sucks that much this was probably a nice hotel before the freeway was added only feet from our room  literally we couldn t hear ourselves think and had to turn the tv up very loud to drown out the constant and i mean constant stream of traffic just outside our window while it may be true that we are country folk with different ideas about noise i cannot imagine that any sane person would not be driven mad in a short time by the constant and droning high decibel intrusion that filled our every moment in that over priced over hyped over the hill  literally  hollywood my foot poor excuse for a room the socalled kid s suite was no more than a cheap piece of plywood or such that was thrown up in a normalsize room and annoyingly plastered with cheap rundown and blatant hollywood universal advertising and as as such was no more than a broom closet for kids and not much of a bonus or perk worth the extra money except for the 1 4 illusion there was not much of a separation as we were led to believe the amusements for children were also pretty much nonexistentent except for whining about all the things that there were not to do however anyone with a skin condition that thinks that they can be cured with heavy chlorine therapy you are in luck because the pool is open for business come on in management was nonexistent and as a previous reviewer stated  they were always in a meeting and over the course of 3 days no one could be bothered to call us back and address our concerns never again and never should you  what a rip

we were pleased our family spent 2 nights at the hotel in august and were fully satisfied hotel is well maintained well located and suitable for families kids ate free in the hotel restaurant upon arrival the standard room we had reserved was not available so they immediately without asking a gave us a minisuitesame price b free parking for our whole stay  an 18 savings c two passes for 2 free dinners in the hotel restaurant our stay was otherwise uneventful i would certainly consider staying here again
